2452.text: Then shalt thou speak these words, also at the second, third, fourth, fifth, and sixth holes. Then shall the unclean (person) sit down in the middle of a hole below the other holes.7

2454.text: With the dust from these (holes) he may purify himself by plentiful rubbings; (he may rub himself with dust plentifully).8

2455.text: They shall wait so long until he is dry on his head from the topmost hair.

2456.text: Until his body is dry, until the dust is dry.9

2457.text: Then shall the unclean [person] come to the other holes.

2458.text: At the first hole shall he (wash himself) once with water, then he purifies his body..

2459.text: At the second hole shall he (wash himself) twice with water, then he purifies his body.

2460.text: At the third hole shall he (wash himself) thrice with water, then he purifies his body.

2461.text: Then let them fumigate him with Urvâçni, Vôhû-gaona, Yôhû-kereti, Hadha-naêpata.† or any of the odoriferous trees.

2462.text: Then he shall gird himself with [his] garment.

2463.text: To his dwelling then shall he go, the unclean [person].

2464.text: In the place of uncleanness shall he sit down in the midst of the dwelling afar from the other Mazdayaçnians.

2465.text: He may not come to fire, water, earth, cattle, trees, nor to the pure man, and not to the pure woman,

2466.text: Until that three nights are passed.

2467.text: After three nights he shall wash his naked body with cow’s urine, and water, then is he clean.

2468.text: He shall sit down in the place of uncleanness in the midst of the dwelling, remote from the other Mazdayacnians.

2469.text: He may not come to the fire, or water, not to the earth, cattle, or trees, not to the pure man, and not to the pure woman,

2470.text: Until that six nights are flown.

2471.text: After six nights shall he wash his naked body with cow’s urine and water, then is he clean.

2472.text: He shall sit down in the place of uncleanness in the midst of the dwelling remote from the other Mazdayacnians.

2473.text: He cannot come to the fire, not to the water, not to the earth, not to the cattle, not to the trees, not to the pure man, and not to the pure woman,

2474.text: Until that nine nights are flown.

2475.text: After nine nights he shall wash his naked body with cow’s urine and water, then is he clean.

2476.text: Then can he come to the fire and to the water, to the earth, to the cattle, to the trees, to the pure man, to the pure woman.10

2477.text: Let them purify an Athrava for a pious blessing.

2478.text: The lord of a district let them purify for a large male camel.*

2479.text: The lord of a tribe let them purify for a large male horse.

2480.text: The lord of a clan let them purity for a large bull.

2481.text: The master of a house let them purify for a wallring † cow.

2482.text: The mistress of a house let them purify for a ploughing ‡ cow.11

2483.text: The dweller in the clan, if he is [a man] of substance, let them purify for a cow that bears burdens. §

2484.text: A little child, || let them purify for a a small beast.¶

2485.text: If the Mazdayacnians are able, then shall they give to the man who purifies (them) this cattle or these bea3ts of burden.

2486.text: If the Mazdayacnians are not able to give him this cattle or these beasts of burden, then shall they bring to this man (who purifies), other goods.

2487.text: Until this man who purifies departs from these dwellings contented and without hatred.

2488.text: If the man who purifies depart from these dwellings discontented and with hatred ; **

2489.text: Then afterwards, 0 holy Zarathustra, this Drukhs Naçus defiles then from the nose, the eyes, the tongue, the cheeks, the hinder parts.*

2490.text: On their nails (the evil doers’) springs the Drukhs Naçus.

2491.text: Then are they unclean for ever.

2492.text: For unwillingly, 0 holy Zarathustra, shines the sun upon the unclean, unwillingly the moon, unwillingly these stars.

2493.text: For he who purifies makes content, he who removes the Naçus from the unclean, 0 holy Zarathustra ;

2494.text: He makes the fire content,† he makes the water content, he makes the earth content, he makes the cattle content, he make3 the trees content, he makes the pure man content, he makes the pure woman content.

2495.text: Zarathustra asked : Creator of the corporeal world, Pure !

2496.text: What does that man receive as a reward, when body and soul have separated, who removes the Naçus from an unclean [person] ?

2497.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda: Let them promise this man, ‡ as his reward in the next world, the attaining of Paradise.

2498.text: Zarathustra asked him : Creator of the corporeal world, Pure One !

2499.text: How shall I subdue the Drukhs which assaults the living from the dead ; how shall I subdue the Naçus which defiles the living from the dead ?12

2500.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda: Speak the words which are called Bishâmruta§ among the Gâthâs.13

2501.text: Speak the words which are called Thrishâmrûta, speak the words which are called Chathrûshâmrûta.

2502.text: Like as an arrow [which is] shot away, like as grass which has been dead for a year, like as the annual covering (of the earth), so, 0 holy Zarathustra, does this Naçus melt away.

2503.text: Creator! If such a man performs the sprinkling who has not learned to know the Mazdayaçnian law from one who purifies :

2504.text: How shall I then subdue the Drukhs which flies from the dead upon the living ?

2505.text: How shall I subdue this Naçus which defiles the living from the dead ?

2506.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda : This Drukhs Naçus becomes as it were more deadly than it was before.

2507.text: It increases sickness, death, and opposition, just as before.

2508.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda: With a chain shall the Mazdayaçnians chain him :

2509.text: His hands shall they first fetter; they shall take away his clothes from him :

2510.text: At the broad of the skin* shall they cut off his head.

2511.text: Let them give his body to the devouring creatures of Çpënta-mainyus; the carnivorous (ones), the birds and the Kahrkàças.14

2512.text: Thu3 let them say : This (man) repents himself of all wicked thoughts, words, and deeds.

2513.text: If he has committed other wicked deeds,

2515.text: If he has not committed other evils deeds;

2516.text: Then are they confessed for this man for ever.†

2517.text: “Who is he, 0 Ahura-Mazda, who attacked me, who took away comfort, who took away increase, who brought hither sickness, who brought hither death ?

2518.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda : He it was, 0 holy Zara-thustra, the unclean Ashemaŏgha ;

2519.text: Who in the corporeal world takes up purification without having learned the Mazdayaçnian law from one who purifies.

2520.text: Formerly, ‡ 0 holy Zarathustra, there were produced in these places and localities food § and fatness, healthfulness and healing remedies, || good health, spreading abroad and increase, besides the increase of corn and fodder.

2521.text: Creator! How will food and fatness, healthfulness and healing remedies, good healfh, spreading abroad and increase, thriving of corn and fodder, return again to these places and localities ?

2522.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda : Food and fatness, healthfulness and healing remedies, good health, spreading abroad and increase, thriving of corn and fodder, will not return to these places and localities,

2523.text: Before this unclean Ashemaŏgha lies there smitten down,15

2524.text: Or until they praise the holy Çraosha three days and three nights in these regions.

2525.text: At ¶ the burning fire, with the Bĕrêçma bound together with uplifted Haŏma.

2526.text: Then return to these places again food and fatness, healthfulness and healing remedies, good health, spreading abroad and increase, thriving of corn and fodder.

2919.text: May the allied1 desire Him, His deeds, with obedience. According to His mind are we, ye Daevas, the rejoicers of Ahura, May we be thy messengers, the restraining, who torment yon.

2920.text: To them answered Mazda-Ahura, ruling through Yohu-manô, From his kingdom, the very friendly with the shining Asha, The perfect Ârmaiti teach we to you to know. May she be ours.

2921.text: Ye Daevas are all the descendants of Ako-manô, Whoso brings to you many offerings belongs to the Drujas and to evil-mindedness. Ye come to me (?) according to your deceit, ye who spread abroad unbelief on the seven-fold earth.

2922.text: What ever is good that evil men pervert, They are called friends of the Daevas, revolted from Vohu-manô, Removing themselves from the understanding of Ahura-Mazda and of purity.

2923.text: Of both does he defraud men : of fullness and immortality, When to you, Daevas, Aka-mainyu, through evil mind, Teaches evil deeds and words,—dominion for the wicked.

2924.text: Much punishment does man obtain, if thus as He has announced, Ahura should reckon openly, He who is aware through the

2925.text: Among these wretches no one knows anything, namely, that which is manifest at the stroke, What he teaches (as) deadly, what is known as the beat steel, Their going astray knowest Thon, Ahura, best.*

2926.text: To these bad spake Yima the son of Vivanhaô, Who has taught us men to eat flesh in morsels,3 From these will I be distinguished by Thee, 0 Mazda.

2927.text: The false prayers, they slay through their teaching the soul of life. They take away my good that is hotly desired by Vohu-manô. With these prayers of my soul entreat I you, Mazda and Asha-

2928.text: He slays my words, who there utters what is evil to see

2929.text: He slays me, who thinks the life of the bad as the greatest, (So that) cheerful possession is taken away from the masters of houses and the mistresses of houses, He who, 0 Mazda, wishes to wound the best pure soul.

2930.text: The men who by their teaching hinder from good deeds, To these has Mazda announced evil, to them who slay the Soul of the Cow with friendly speech.4 To whom morsels are dearer than purity,5 the Karapas among those who wish dominion in evil way.

2931.text: Whoso wishes the reading of the kingdom, he belongs to the abode of the most wicked spirit, As the destroyer of this world, and he who wishes, 0 Mazda,

2932.text: He makes himself guilty of great dismemberment, he gives his understanding to the Kavayas. He who deceives the active, if they accept the wicked for protection. If he brings that which was spoken for slaying the Cow as protection to him who is far from death.*

2933.text: Away also will I drive you from us, ye Karapas and Kevît-ayas, Away to those whom one does not make as rulers over life, They who bring away both6 in the dwelling of Yohu-manô.

2934.text: All that comes from the best, which teaches good to the soul,Ahura-Mazda rules over that which is manifest to me, and what is hidden, What is presented as punishment for the wicked ........... †

2935.text: As is right, so does He who created the first place, The Master, the most righteous deeds for the evil as for the good, What is false, that mixes itself with that which he possesses of good.

2936.text: Whoso harm on the wicked, be it with words, be it with the understanding, Be it with the hands inflicts, or gives good to the body, He gives according to the wish and will of Ahura-Mazda.

2937.text: Whoso is the best for the pure, be it through relationship*or deeds, Or through obedience, 0 Ahura, caring for the cattle with activity, He finds himself in the service of Asha and of Vohu-manô.

2938.text: I curse, 0 Mazda, disobedience against Thee and the evil-inindedness, The despising of relationship, the Drukhs nearest to the work,† The disdainer of obedience, the bad measure of the fodder of the cattle.

2939.text: I to thy Çraŏsha, ‡ as the greatest of all, call for help: Give us long life in the kingdom of Vohu-manô, Unto the pure paths of purity, in which Ahura-Mazda dwells.

2940.text: What Zaŏta (walks) in the pure (paths) of purity he desires after the heavenly Paradise, From him has he help through the Spirit, who thinks the works which are to be done, These are desired by Thee, Ahura-Mazda, for seeing and conversation,

2941.text: Come to me ye best, of Himself may Mazda show to us, Together with Asha and Vohu-manô, who are to be praised before the greatest ; May the manifest offerings be manifest to us the worshippers.

2942.text: Teach me to know both laws that I may walk with Vohu-manô. (Teach me to know) the offering of Thy equal Mazda, then your laudable sayings, 0 Asha, Which were made by you as help for Ameretât, as reward for Haurvat.

2943.text: May the dominion greatly increase to Thee, Mazda, (and) to this heavenly (Vohu-manô); May there come brightness, enduring, wisdom through the best spirit, Accomplishment of that whereby the souls cohere.§

2944.text: All the enjoyments of life, which were and still are, And which will be, these distribute according to Thy will; May I increase through Vohu-manô, Khshathra and Asha in happiness for the body,

2945.text: Purify* me, 0 Lord, through Ârmaiti, give me strength. Holiest, Heavenly Mazda, give me at my supplication in goodness, Through Asha strong power, through Vohu-manô fullness of good.

2946.text: To teach afar for (Thy) rejoicing give me certainty, That from the kingdom, 0 Ahura, which belongs to the blessings of Vohu-manô.Teach us, 0 Çpĕnta-ârmaiti, the law with purity.

2947.text: Zarathustra gives as a gift the soul from his body, (Give to him) the precedence of good mind, O Mazda, Purity in deed and in word, obedience and dominion.

2948.text: The immortality which I (have obtained), through deeds, words, and offerings,1 And purity, give I to Thee, 0 Mazda, and the dominion of plenty, Of these give we to Thee, Ahura, first.

2949.text: And so to Thee, by means of the soul, are also given all good things of Voha-manò, As also through the actions of the pure man, whose soul is bound with purity, I come to Your adoration, 0 Mazda, with full prayers.

2950.text: So offer we Myazda to Thee with prayer, 0 Ahura, and to Asha, May all good things which are nourished by Vohu-manò, be in Thy kingdom, For he is wholly wise who ever brings profit to such as Yon.

2951.text: We desire hither Thy strong fire, 0 Ahura, together with Asha, The very swift, powerful, manifestly affording protection to him who rejoices it.

2952.text: What is Your kingdom, what Your desire for works ?2 for to You, 0 Mazda, I belong. With purity and good-mindedness will I support Your poor, But all ye we renounce : Daevas and perverted men.

2953.text: lf You really exist,Mazda,together withAsha andVohu-manô,Then give me this token :3 all the dwellings of this place, That offering I may join myself to you in friendship—praising draw nigh (to You).

2954.text: Where are Thy worshippers, Mazda, who are known to Vohu-manô ? The intelligent; carries out the excellent precepts in joy and sorrow. None other hut you know I, 0 Asha, so save us.

2955.text: Through those deeds they terrify us, in which destruction is laid for many, When there was mighty there as deceiver, the oppressor of Thy law, 0 Mazda. Those who think not purity, from these hastens Vohu-manô afar.

2956.text: Those who the holy wisdom, which is desired by them that know Thee, Destroy with evil deeds, from ignorance of Vohu-manô, From them purity flies far away, so long as they are thereby wicked and corrupt.*

2957.text: Let the wise announce the laying hold on Vohu-manô with the deed, (Let) him who knows (announce) the holy Wisdom, the skilful, the abode of purity, But all that,4 0 Mazda, may they drive out from Thy kingdom.

2958.text: For both serve Thee for food : Haurvat and Ameretât, The realms of Vohu-manô, Asha, together with Ârmaitis increase, Let strength and power belong to them, Thou, 0 Mazda, art then without hurt.

2959.text: What is Thine ordination, what Thy wish, be it praise, be it offering ? Let it be announced, 0 Mazda, say who fulfils Your command the purest. Teach us, Asha, the paths which belong there to Vohu-manô.

2960.text: The way of Vohu-manô of which Thou hast spoken to me, The law of the Profitable, in which he who does right from purity, finds it is well with him. Where the reward which Thou hast promised to the wise is given to Thine.

2961.text: This wish, 0 Mazda, grant to the soul endowed with body : Works of Vohu-manô, for those who labour with the walking cow,5 Your wisdom, 0 Ahura, efficacy of the soul which furthers purity.

2962.text: Mazda ! announce to me the best words and deeds, These are to Thee, together with Vohu-manô and Asha, the debt of praise,Through Thy realm makest Thou, Ahura, increasing at will, the place manifest.

2963.text: (Raçpi). Ahura-Mazda, the Pure, Lord of purity, praise we. The Amĕsha-çpĕntas, the good rulers, the wise, praise we.

2964.text: The whole world of purity praise we, the heavenly as the earthly,

2965.text: With desire after the good purity, with desire after the good Mazdayaçnian law.†

2966.text: (Zaŏta). Of the good thoughts, words, and works, which here and elsewhere

2967.text: Have been done, or will yet be done,

2968.text: The praisers and propagators are we, that we may belong to the good.

2969.text: That we believe, Ahura-Mazda, Pure, Fair,

2970.text: That will we think, say, and do :

2971.text: Which is best among the works of men for both worlds, ‡

2972.text: Through these best deeds now pray we that for the cattle,

2973.text: Pleasantness and fodder may be distributed,

2974.text: To the learned as to the unlearned, to the mighty as to the weak.—

2975.text: (May) the kingdom (belong) to the best Ruler, wherefore we it to Him

2978.text: What now both—man or woman—manifestly know,

2979.text: That may they, if it is anything good, speak out, act thereby, and also spread wider,

2980.text: For those who act even so as this is.*

2982.text: And His best worship we meditate, and the best fodder for the cattle. †

2983.text: Yours we do, we spread abroad, what we desire from You,

2984.text: In the dominion of purity, in the wish for purity (is)

2985.text: For every living being the best in both worlds.

2986.text: These spoken words, Ahura-Mazda, utter we well, thinking purity.

2987.text: Thee we make their hearer and teacher.

2988.text: On account of Thy purity, good-mindedness, good dominion,

2989.text: Is Thy laud higher than all laud, Thine hymns higher than all hymns, Thy praise higher than all praise.

2990.text: We approach ourselves first to Thee, Mazda-Ahura, through the service of the fire. ‡

2991.text: To Thee, Holiest Spirit, who the torment

2992.text: Requitest upon him who decrees it. §

2993.text: Happy is the man to whom thou comest mightily, fire, son of Ahura-Mazda.

2994.text: More friendly than the most friendly, more worthy of adoration than the most worthy of honour.

2995.text: Mayest thou come helpfully to us at the greatest business. ||

2996.text: Fire, thou art acquainted with Ahura-Mazda, acquainted with the heavenly.

2997.text: Thou art the holiest of the same (the fire), that bears the name Yàzista.

2998.text: 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, we draw near to thee

2999.text: With good mind, with good purity,

3000.text: With deeds and words of good wisdom draw we near to thee.

3001.text: We praise Thee, we acknowledge ourselves as Thy debtors, Mazda-Ahura.

3002.text: With all good thoughts, with all good words, with all good works, we draw nigh unto Thee.

3003.text: This Thy body, the fairest of all bodies, we invite, Mazda-Ahura,

3004.text: The greatest among the great lights :

3005.text: That which they call the Sun.

3006.text: Here praise I now Ahura-Mazda, who has created the cattle, who has created purity, the water and the good trees.

3007.text: Who created the splendour of light, the earth, and all good.

3008.text: To Him belongs the kingdom, the might, the power.

3009.text: We praise Him first among the adorable beings,

3010.text: Which dwell together with the cattle.*

3011.text: Him praise we with Ahurian name, Mazda,

3012.text: With our own bodies and life praise we Him.

3013.text: The Fravashis of the pure, men and women, we praise.

3015.text: What is fairest, what pure, what immortal,

3016.text: What brilliant, all that is good :

3017.text: The good spirit we honour, the good kingdom we honour,

3018.text: And the good law, and the good rule, and the good wisdom.

3019.text: This earth, together with the women, we praise,

3020.text: Which bears us, which are Thy women, Ahura-Mazda,

3021.text: Whose wishes arise from purity, these we praise.

3023.text: The good holiness (which arises) through them, the good wish.

3024.text: The good fullness, the good blessing, the good Pârendi,praise we.

3025.text: The waters praise we, the dropping, flowing (?), forward-running.

3026.text: The arising from. Ahura, the well-working, having good fords.

3027.text: The well-flowing, well-washing, desirable for both worlds.

3028.text: Which names Ahura-Mazda has given to you, the good.

3029.text: He the Giver of good, whatever He may have given, with these we praise you,

3030.text: With these we invoke you, with these we pray to you, with these we confess ourselves as your debtors.

3031.text: You, the water Azi, Mâtaras, Agenayô, Dregudâya,*

3032.text: (Yon) the lords over all, will we invoke, the best, fairest, you, ye good, on account of offering.

3033.text: (Who) with long arms lead (the body of the world) without creating, without speaking : the Mâtarô jîtayô (milk).†

3034.text: Here praise we now the soul and body of the Bull,

3035.text: Then our souls, and the souls of the cattle, which desire to maintain us in life,

3036.text: FOR whom these, who are for those.‡

3037.text: The souls of those going a-foot, and of the riders,§ praise we.

3038.text: Then we praise the souls of the pure, who have ever been born, men and women,

3039.text: Whose good laws one honours, will honour, and has honoured.

3040.text: Then we invoke the good men and women,

3042.text: Who dwell together with Vohu-manô and the female (Genii) also.

3043.text: As Thou, Ahura-Mazda, hast thought, spoken, done, and created what (is) good,

3044.text: So we give to Thee, offer to Thee, praise Thee,

3045.text: Pray to Thee, acknowledge ourselves as Thy debtors, Ahura-Mazda,

3046.text: By means of the individuality of the good self, the good holiness, come we to Thee.

3047.text: (By means of the individuality) of the good rule over the cattle, of the good wisdom. ||

3048.text: From place to place, Mazda-Ahura, will I bring forth wisdom and fullness,

3049.text: As gifts for Thee, Lord of the understanding, on account of that which is above.¶

3050.text: What reward Thou hast given to those of the same law as myself, Mazda-Ahura,

3051.text: That give also to us for this world, and that beyond.

3052.text: May we thus attain to that which is so,

3053.text: To union with Thy purity to all eternity.*

3054.text: Let the pure men, Mazda-Ahura, who desire after purity,

3055.text: Warriors as well as husbandmen, be long mighty, long rejoiced.

3057.text: So may relationship, worship, and friendship he,

3058.text: That we may lift ourselves up and he Yours, Mazda-Ahura, as pure and truthful, with sacrifice and offering.

3059.text: Hymns, reverential adoration, to Ahura-Mazda and Asha-Vahiata,

3060.text: We give, we spread abroad, and we make known.

3061.text: May we attain Thy good kingdom, Mazda-Ahura, for ever.

3062.text: Thou art our Ruler, possessed of the good kingdom, for men as well as for women,

3063.text: The Wisest among beings in both worlds.

3064.text: The good increase we bestow on Thee, the worthy of adoration, the Friend of purity.

3065.text: Mayest Thou be to us life and body,

3066.text: Thou, the Wisest among the creatures in both worlds.—

3067.text: May we show ourselves worthy, may we live, Ahura-Mazda,

3068.text: In joy in Thee a long life, may we desire after Thee and be mighty.

3069.text: Rejoice us long and well, 0 Wisest among beings.

3070.text: As Thy praisers and psalmists, 0 Ahura-Mazda,

3071.text: We come, we desire, and we obey.

3072.text: What reward Thou hast given to my equal according to the law, 0 Ahura,

3073.text: That give to me also for earth as well as for heaven.

3075.text: Under Thy rule, Pure, for all eternity.— †

3076.text: We praise, Amĕsha-çpĕntas, your portion of the Yaçna Haptanhàiti. ‡

3077.text: The abode of the water praise we, the fords § of the water praise we.

3078.text: The separating of the ways, the meeting of the ways, praise we.

3079.text: The mountains which make the water to flow, the Varas * which give water, praise we.

3080.text: The youths on horses † praise we, the protectors, the unconstrained, praise we.

3081.text: Mazda and Zarathustra we praise, the earth and the heavens we praise.

3082.text: The strong wind created by Ahura-Mazda we praise, the Taêra ‡ of the Hara-berezaiti praise we.

3083.text: The earth and all good things praise we.

3084.text: Vohu-manô and the souls of the pure praise we.

3086.text: We praise the pure ass which stands in the midst of the sea Vôuru-kasha. ||

3088.text: We praise the Haŏma, the golden, great.

3089.text: Haŏma, the giver of increase, the furtherer of the world, praise we.

3090.text: Haŏma who is far from death praise we.

3091.text: The flowing of the water praise we, the flight of birds praise we.

3092.text: The coming of the Âthravas praise we,

3093.text: Who come hither from afar,¶ desiring purity for the regions.

3095.text: Hail to him who suffices for happiness to each1 May Ahura create, ruling after his own wish ! May power and strength (come to me) according to Thy will : That I may be able to maintain purity, give me that, 0 Ârmaiti : (Namely) kingdom, blessing, and the life of Yohu-manô.2

3096.text: To the man full of brightness may the brightness Which is the best of all, be given ! Manifest Thyself, 0 Holiest, Heavenly Mazda, Thou who createdst, 0 Pure, the good things of Vohu-manô,3 Day by day from love for long life,4

3097.text: May every man attain the best, Who teaches us to know the right paths for profit, For this corporeal world as well as for the spiritual. The manifest towards the worlds in which Ahura dwells, (And) the offerer, who is like Thee, wise, holy, 0 Mazda!

3098.text: Thee thought I as the Strong as well as the Holy, 0 Mazda, As Thou with thine own hand protectest The blessing, which Thou hast created for the good as well as

3099.text: For the Holy one held I Thee, Mazda-Ahura, When I first saw Thee at the origin of the world, As Thou effectest that deeds and prayers find their reward. Evil for the evil, good blessings for the good, At the last dissolution of the Creation through Thy virtue,

3100.text: At this dissolution there will come to Thy kingdom, 0 Holy, Heavenly Mazda, through good-mindedness,He through whose deeds the world increases in purity.

3101.text: For the Holy One held I Thee, Mazda-Ahura, As it came to me through Vohu-manô, And asked me, “ Who art thou, to whom dost thou belong?” How shall I at the question teach to know the signs of the day, In reference to Thy worlds and the bodies?6

3102.text: Then spake Zarathustra to Him first:

3103.text: For the Holy One held I Thee, Mazda-Ahura, When it came to me through Vohu-manô, Asking me, “ What wilt thou know ? “ For Thy fire the offerings of holy praise, As much as I can and think, †

3104.text: Give Thou to me perfect purity, since I desire it for myself, Thon who art bound -with wisdom. Ask us the questions which thou hast for us, For thy questions are those of the mighty,7 Since to thee the Ruler gives strength at will.

3105.text: As the Holy One thought I Thee, Mazda, When it came to me through Vohu-manô, When it was first taught me through Your prayer, That the spreading abroad of the law through me among men was something difficult. That will I do which was said to me as the best.

3106.text: Since Thou hast commanded me : “ Come especially to the pure,” So command me not that which will not be heard, So that I lift myself up before for me has arrived Obedience united with great blessing, Which will turn Your pure gifts to profit for the warriors.8

3107.text: As the Holy One thought I Thee, Mazda, When it came to me through Yohu-manô, (That) I should teach the right guidance of the will. Give me the (reward) Of a long life, as no one obtains from you, Among the desirable of creation, who are named in Thy

3108.text: The wished for, what a wise man gives to his friend, (Is) for me, 0 Mazda, Thy perfect rejoicing. What thou, 0 Khshathra, hast commanded from purity (With that) will I encourage the heads of the doctrine Together with all those who recite thy Mańthraa.

3109.text: As the Holy One thought I Thee, Ahura, When it came to me through Vohu-manô, and Gave tokens for the understanding: Swift thought is the best, A perfect man shall not seek to make a bad one contented, Then become all the bad to Thee as holy. *

3110.text: I, Zarathustra, 0 Ahura, rejoice myself with the heavenly, I am of all the holiest.

3111.text: That ask I Thee, tell me the right,, 0 Ahura, Unto the praise of Your praise mayest Thou, O Mazda, teach me, the friend.Through purity may friendly helpers be our portion Until he shall come to us through Vohu-manô.

3112.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura, How is the beginning of the best place (Paradise), How is it to profit (him) who desires after both? * For Thou art through purity—the Holy over the wicked— The Ruler over all, the Heavenly, the Friend for both worlds, Mazda !

3113.text: That ask I Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura! Who was the father of the pure creatures at the beginning? Who has created the way of the Sun, of the Stars ? Who (other than) Thou (causest) that the Moon waxes and wanes ? That, Mazda, and other [things] I desire to know.

3114.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura I Who upholds the earth, and the unsupported ? † So that they fall not,—who the waters and trees? Who has united swiftness with the winds and the clouds ? Who, 0 Mazda, is the creator of Vohu-manô (mankind) ?

3115.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura! Who, working good, has made light as well as darkness ? Who, working good, sleep and waking ? Who the morning dawns, the noons, the nights? Who (him) who considers the measures of the law ? *

3116.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura !z`

3117.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura !

3118.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! Thy five-fold ‡ precept, 0 Mazda, The prayers, according to which Thou art asked through

3119.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! How shall I maintain pure for myself the pure law, Which the Lord of the wise realm teaches ? Truthful kingdoms (possessest Thou) : swiftness, 0 Mazda, Thou who rejoicest the dwelling with Asha and Vohu-manô.

3120.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura! About the law which is the best for beings, Which furthers me continually the worlds in purity, Makes right with the words and deeds of perfect wisdom— For my wisdom I desire Thy gifts of fortune, 0 Mazda !

3121.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Mazda! How does a share in wisdom come to those To whom, 0 Mazda, Thy law is announced ?§ I desire to know Thee first of them, All the others will I watch from hate of the (evil) spirit.

3122.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! Who is pure among those for whom I ask, who wicked? To whom (cleaves) the evil, is he himself the evil ? Who to me as a wicked one opposed Thy profit as a foe, Wherefore is he not the evil whom one takes as such ?

3123.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! How shall we drive away the Drujas from here? Away to those who are the champions of disobedience ;* Who do not unite themselves to the pure when they mark him, Do not desire after that for which the pure spirit asks.

3124.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! How shall I through purity get the Drujas into my power?† In order to slay them with the Mańthras of Thy precept, Bring forth a mighty overthrow among the wicked, (Bring it) to the deceivers and godless that they may not come again.

3125.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura! Whether Thou rulest openly in that time with purity When both the imperishable hosts come together ? ‡ According to those laws § which Thou, O Mazda, teachest. Where, and to which of both, givest Thou the victory 1

3126.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! Who is the victoriously smiting, through (Thy) powerful word, (those) who are ? || Make manifest to me a wise lord for the creatures in both worlds. May obedience come, through the good spirit, To that one whomsoever Thou wilt, 0 Mazda I

3127.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura ! When shall I attain to the dispensation which proceeds from For your completion, which is the wish of my words ? ¶ That Haurvat and Ameretât may be Rulers, According to this Mańthra which is the gate which proceeds from purity.

3128.text: That will I ask Thee, tell’me the right, 0 Ahura ! How shall I, through purity, make myself worthy of reward ? Ten male horses and one camel, Which Haurvat and Ameretât have promised me, That I may offer both to Thee.

3129.text: That will I ask Thee, tell me the right, 0 Ahura! He who withholds this reward from the worthy, If one gives nothing to him, the truth-speaking, What is the punishment there-for at first ? I know (already) that which will follow at last.

3130.text: Have the Daevas ever been good rulers? Of that I ask ; who will war against these Through whom the Karapas and Uçikhschas* give the Cow to Aeshma, (Through whom) the Kavas so greatly increased themselves. Fodder is not to be given to them through Asha as a reward.

3131.text: Now will I say to yon, now give ear unto me, now hear, Ye who are near, ye who are afar, that which is desired ; It is now manifest, the Wise † have created all. Evil doctrine shall not for the second time destroy the world, Evil choice has the bad lighted on with the tongue. ‡

3132.text: Now will I announce : the two Heavenly Ones at the be- ginning of the world,’— Of these Two thus spake the Holy to the Evil : “ Not do our souls, not our doctrines, not our understanding, Not our wishes, not our sayings, not our works, Not the laws, not the souls unite themselves.”§

3133.text: Now will I say to you what as the first in the world The Wise Ahura-Mazda has said to me : “ He among you who will not act according to this Mańthra, Namely, according to the spirit as well as the word, To him will the end of the world turn to downfall.”

3134.text: Now will I announce to you who is the best in this world, (Proceeding) from holiness, Mazda knows (him) Who created him: The father of the good effective spirit His daughter is Armaiti, the well-doing, Not to be deceived is Ahura, the All-knowing. ||

3135.text: Now will I say to you what the Holiest has said to me : A prayer which they shall recite, the best for men, He who therefore renders me obedience, and teaches it farther,

3136.text: Now will I say to you, the greatest thing of all : Praise with purity (of him), the wise there, (of those) who are. May Holiest, Heavenly Ahura-Mazda, hear it,

3137.text: He for whose profit desire all the offerers, Who were ever living or are so still. Immortality is the wish of the soul of the pure, (And) strength, which is a weapon against the wicked, (And) the kingdom, (whose) Creator is Ahura-Mazda.

3138.text: Him will we serve with praiseworthy prayers, For now is it evident to the eyes, He who in works and words of the good Spirit Knows purity, he (knows) Ahura-Mazda.

3139.text: Him will we content with good-mindedness, Who made the rejoicing and the unjoyful serviceable to us. May Mazda-Ahura make kingdoms serviceable to us, Our cattle, our men, so that they may increase Through the purity of Vohu-manô, unto the good birth.*

3140.text: To Him desire I to draw near with the offering of Armaiti, Who is called with name as the Wise Lord. He who announces Him with purity and good-mindedness, To him will Haurvat and Ameretât in the kingdom Continually give power and strength.

3141.text: May there come to the Daevas, then to men, Scorn, if they scorn Him, The contrary if they highly esteem Him : To the serviceable wise is through the Holy Spirit,

3142.text: What land shall I praise, whither shall I go praying, After that I have imparted individuality and obedience. † Those do not make me contented who act after their own pleasure,

3143.text: I know that I, 0 Mazda, am without concupiscence, I have little wealth, few men, ‡ I complain to Thee, mayeet Thou see it,OAhnra, Affording joy, which a fiiend gives to the friend : Instruction, (and) the pure goods of Vohu-man O Pure !

3144.text: When, 0 Mazda, come the ncreasers of the days, § Who step forwards to the maintenance of the pure world,

3145.text: They who do purity, these the wicked hinders, The cows from going forwards through the districts and regions, He, the tyrant, worthy of death by his deeds, He who by resistance to him takes away the rule or the life, 0 Mazda ! He obtains for the cows, the granaries of wisdom. *

3146.text: Whoso as Ruler gives not to him who brings hurt— Skilled from the law, or from the covenant, Whoso as a right liver, [and] pure (does not give) to the

3147.text: What man does not willingly approach him, He goes openly over to the creation of the Drujas, For he is a wicked one who is the best for the wicked. The pure, to whom the pure is friendly, So long as the first law endures, 0 Ahura !

3148.text: Whom has Mazda appointed as protector for my fellows, If the wicked chooses me for vengeance? What other than thee, the fire and the spirit, Through both of whose deeds purity is increased, This help for the law tell me.

3149.text: He who commits these earthly goods to the foe, My punishment will not strike him for these shameful deeds,† Through tormenting there comes to him that To [his] body which drives him away from the good life, (But) not ever from the wicked, through hatred against Mazda. ‡

3150.text: Who is the offerer, who first Leaches me How I may exalt Thee according to wish, In (my) doing (Thee) the Holy, Pure Ahura ? What thou (possessest) pure, what the Maker of the Cow aid pure, That desire I from Thee, through Vohu-manÔ.

3151.text: What man or what woman, 0 Mazda-Ahura, Gives me in this world the best that thou knowest : Blessing for purity, the kingdom through Vohu-rnanô, And (for those) whom I exhort to Your praise,With all these go I forwards to the bridge Chinvat.

3152.text: To empire have the Karapas and Kavis * united themselves In order through wicked deeds to destroy the world for men, Whose own souls, whose own state, becomes hard.† If they come thither where the bridge Chinvat is, So will they for ever place themselves in the abode of the Drujas.

3153.text: When purity in the families and races

3154.text: What man, the holy Zarathuatra, through gifts Among men makes contented, he is worthy to be praised, To him gives Ahura-Mazda a place,§ He increases to him the earthly goods, through Vohu-manô, Him hold I for you, on account of his purity, as a good friend.

3155.text: Zarathustra! what pure one is thy friend With sublime greatnes, or who is it who desires to praise ? It is that Kavà-Vîstâçpa, the warlike; But whom he, Mazda-Ahura, leads amongst his kinsmen, Them praise I with the prayers of good-rnindedness.

3156.text: I praise you, the Holy belonging to Haêchat-açpâ You who divide between good creation and wicked, Through these your deeds holiness is given to you As the first creatures of Ahura.

3157.text: Frashaŏstra ! take thou there the reward, 0 Hvô-gvâ, || with which we also are content, for happiness There, where Armaitis is enthroned with Asha There, where are the wished-for realms of Vohu-manô, There, where Mazda-Ahura dwells in the self-chosen place.

3158.text: There, where also only the measured ¶ will be spoken Not the unmeasured, through the wise Jâmâçpa Hvô-gvâ, Continually he comes to you with prayers, the offerings of obedience, He who divides between good and bad creation, Ye Wise Thinkers, Asha and Ahura-Mazda.

3159.text: Whoso for my sake here continually does the best To him grant I of my goods through Vohu-manô (reward), Oppressing him who oppresses us. Mazda and Asha, in your desire I find contentment, That is the decision of my understanding and soul.

3160.text: He who to me from holiness thus works openly That which according to his will is the first to Zarathustra, To him they grant as reward the world beyond,

3161.text: Through the holiest Spirit and through the best-mindedness, Which springs from purity with words and works, To us has given fullness and immortality, Good things and understanding, Mazda-Ahura.

3162.text: Of this holiest Spirit best does he, The best through the loud prayers by means of the mouth of Vohu-manô, With the bands of Ârmaiti performs he pure deeds, Through His own wisdom is Mazda the Father of purity.

3163.text: Thou who art also the Holy in Heaven, Thou who hast created the cow as a helpful gift, Thou who givest her fodder and delight according to Thy wisdom, When thou, Mazda, hast consulted with Vohu-manô.

3164.text: Hurt arises from this Spirit, the wicked, Not so from the Pure Holy Mazda. Even in a small thing man desires for the pure.† In a great one, if he is able, the bad for the evil.

3165.text: That, Çpĕntâ-Mainyû, Mazda-Ahura, Mayest Thou give to the pure, what is best. Without Thy will the wicked takes a share In his ‡ works ; he who springs from the dwelling of Ako-manô.

3166.text: That hast Thou created, Çpĕnta-Mainyû, Mazda-Ahura, Through the fire gives He decision for the combatants,§ Through the greatness of Armaiti and Asha, For this teaches perfectly him who wishes it,

3167.text: When the coming Asha shall smite the Drukhs, When there comes what was announced as delusive: Immortality for men and Daevas, Then shall Thy profitable laud increase, 0 Ahura ! *

3168.text: Tell me, for Thou knowest it, 0 Ahura ! Before that (the man) reaches to the double † bridge, How shall the pure, 0 Mazda, smite the wicked ? For that is acknowledged in the world as a good accomplishment.

3169.text: To know as the best of teachings are (Those) which the wise Ahura teaches with purity. Thou, the Holy, knowest (also) the hidden teachings, (And) he who resembles Thee, Mazda, through the understanding of Vohu-manô.

3170.text: Whoso makes the mind better, and performs good works, He (acts) according to the law with word and deed, Wealth unites itself with him according to [his] desire and

3171.text: May good kings rule, may bad kings not rule 0ver us, With deeds of good wisdom, 0 Armaiti. Purity is to man the best thing after birth, For the cattle is it laboured, (let) the diligent (bestow) us this for food. ‡

3172.text: This § has to us brightness, this has to us strength (And) might, given, according to the desire of Vohu-manô, So too has it made trees grow -with purity for Mazda At the birth of the first world.

3173.text: Drive away wrath, drive away hatred, (Ye) who are created for the bringing-up of Vohu-manô, For that pure, pleasant thing that the holy man should know, So becomes this creation Thy creation, 0 Mazda. ||

3174.text: How is the desire for Thy good kingdom, 0 Mazda, Which (is it) according to Thy Holiness, for me, 0 Ahura, What shall I desire of thee, 0 Asha, as manifest reward, Living with the deeds of the good Spirit ?

3175.text: How shall I know whether Ye rule over something, Mazda and Asha, whereof a doubt comes to me ? ¶

3176.text: When, 0 Mazda, do the men of understanding come, When will they drive away the dregs of the world, (?) † “Which protect the disobedient in badness, And with understanding the wicked rulers of the regions ?

3177.text: When will Mazda, Asha, together with Armaiti, Come, (and) Khshathra, the good dwelling with fodder ? ‡ Who will command peace to the rude wicked ? To whom arrives the wisdom of Vohu-manô ?

3178.text: They are the Profitable of the regions, Who take to themselves contentment through Vohu-manô, With the works of Thy teaching, 0 pure Mazda, These are created as adversaries against the will §

3179.text: Protect me so long as the perishable world endures as the greatest, I who teach holiness to the wickedly brought up, 0 Mazda, From goodness come hither to those displeasing to me, May I work their destruction through Vohu-manô.

3180.text: To this perishableness fetters me The bad according to the law, || the deceitful, who is wounded by the Holy, He does not hold upright perfect wisdom for this world, He does not ask, 0 Mazda, with good mind,

3181.text: To this belief, 0 Mazda, is added Purity as profit for those true to the law, as wounding for the Drukhs, Therefore will I resign myself to the protection of Vohu-manô. To all Daevas I make known friendship. [?]

3182.text: They who with evil mind increase Aeshma, the wrathful,¶ With their tongues,—inactive among the active, They desire not after good deeds, but after evil,

3183.text: May he, 0 Mazda, possess sweetness and fatness Who possesses the law through good-mindedness. Every one is wise through the purity of Armaiti, All that [is] in Thy kingdom, Ahura ! *

3184.text: I pray from Yon, Mazda and Asha, let it be said: What through the spirit which comes from Your understanding Shall be rightly determined, that we may announce it, The law, (namely), Yours, 0 Ahura!

3185.text: May Mazda hear this, together with Vohu-manô, Hear it Asha, hear it Thou Ahura ! Who is the obedient, who the kinsman, † among the created, Who may place the good blessing in effectiveness ?

3186.text: To Frashaestra hast thou given the friendship of Asha, I desire from Thee him as a master, 0 Mazda-Ahura, And for me (that) whereby one (comes) in goodness to Thy kingdom. May we evermore be beloved (by Thee).

3187.text: May the active, created for profit, hear the precepts.Mayest Thou not give the true words as dominion to the wicked, For with the law is bound the best reward (What) with purity the warlike Jâmâçpa bound.

3188.text: That, 0 Mazda, will I protect in Thy Creation, The good mind and the souls of the pure, Praise (shall bo) to the good things of wisdom,

3189.text: Thither come to the wicked rulers, the evil-doing, evil-speaking, Possessing wicked laws, the evil-minded bad, The souls to meet [them] with evil food,

3190.text: What reward grantest thou, Asha, to the praying Zarathustra, what (grantest thou) through Vohu-manô? (To me) I who worship You with praises, Mazda-Ahura,

3191.text: How and whose protection shall my soul desire, Who is for the cattle, what man ia acknowledged as my protector ? Besides Asha and Thee, Mazda-Ahura, The Desired, the Invoked, by the best spirit.

3192.text: How shall he, Mazda, desire the helpful cow Who wishes her active || for this world To live well during many years ? Give me in the world manifest dwellings as a gift.*

3193.text: There is to the man, Mazda, purity as a portion,Which Khshathra, together with Vohu-manô, imparted to him, Who through the power of holiness seeks to increase This nearest world, in which the wicked takes a share.

3194.text: So will I praise Yon with laud, Mazda-Ahura, Together with Asha and Vohu-manô And Khshathra that he may stand on the way of the desiring, † (And) I give open offerings in Garô-nemâna,

3195.text: Perfectly may You, Mazda-Amira, Asha, Your announcers kindly Instruct with open protection, With mighty, which brings us to brightness.

3196.text: Whoso, 0 Mazda, spreads abroad the words of the Mańthra: The friend Zarathustra with pure prayer, Let him make his tongue to the way of understanding, May he teach me the secrets through Vohu-manô.

3197.text: I unite myself to You, the friendliest companion,To reach to the bridges of Your praise,‡:To (you) the strong: Mazda, Asha, together with Vohu-manô, That you may be guides (?) for my protection.

3198.text: With hymns which are spoken on account of fullness § Come I to You, Mazda, with uplifted hands, To You, with the pure prayer of the offering, || To You, with the virtues of Vohu-manô.

3199.text: With these Yaçnas I offer You praise: Mazda, Asha, with the deeds of Vohu-manô—¶ When I by reason of my purity rule according to wish, Then will I willingly lay hold on ** the wise.

3200.text: I do that which others have done before, What appears worthy in the eyes through Vohu-manô, By the light, by the Sun, the day of the morning. To Your praise, Asha, Mazda-Ahura !††

3201.text: Thy praise will I announce, 0 Mazda, with the mouth So long as I, 0 Asha, can and am able, Let the Creator of the world bestow through Vohu-manô, What is best for the wish of those working openly.

3202.text: The best kingdom, the unbounded, the portion which must be given.* To the distributor of gifts (which) he distributes with righteousness, The best through deeds, that (give) us now to cultivate.

3203.text: That, which belonged to You first, Mazda-Ahura and Asha, And to thee, Armaiti, (that) give me as the kingdom of (my) wish, Give profit to your praise through Vohu-manô.†

3204.text: To You come listening they who rule through Your deeds, Ahura and Asha, with the prayers of Yohu-manô, Which Thou, Mazda, hast first taught.

3205.text: “Where is the Lord of fullness, where is pardon found? Where does one attain to Asha, where is Çpĕnta-ârmaiti? Where is Vohu-manô, where are Thy realms, 0 Mazda ?

3206.text: After all this asks, to support the Cow, from Asha, The active, the pure, with deeds, the wise with prayers, Who is mighty and holy, and announces to the created the

3207.text: Who gives better than the good, who grants to him according to wish, To Ahura-Mazda the kingdom, but him who (arises) from the bad as Holy, Does not requite (until) the final dissolution of the world .‡

3208.text: (Give me, Thou who hast created the Cow and the water, and the trees, Immortality and fullness, Holiest, Heavenly Mazda, Power and strength, instruction through the Best Spirit.

3209.text: Thy sayings, 0 Mazda, may the man announce for knowledge As something hurtful for the wicked, for health (to him) who

3210.text: The wisdom which Thou givest to the warriors through Thy red fire, Through the metal, that give as a token in both worlds, To wound the wicked, to profit the pure.

3211.text: Whoso slays me, except that,* 0 Mazda, He is a companion of the creation of the Drujas, evil (amongst those) who are there, For me, I pray for purity, may Thy parity come in good.

3212.text: What man is a friend of the holy Zarathustra, 0 Mazda, Who Your pure disciple, what is the holy wisdom ? What pure one has announced You, to the glorification of Vohu-manô ?

3213.text: These two did not satisfy him, the Vaepayas and the Kevînas at the Bridge of the Earth.† The holy Zarathustra, when (his) body grew up there

3214.text: The law thinks openly of the wicked “as well as the good, Whose soul trembles on the bridge Chinvat, the notorious, Wishing to attain through their deeds and tongue the path of purity.§

3215.text: The Karapas are not friendly to beings, on account of their activity. Grant Thou also to the Cow fullness through Thy deeds and precepts. But he who (follows) their precepts comes at last to the dwelling of the Drujas.

3216.text: The reward which Zarathustra before imparted to the believer, That he should first come to the shining abode of Ahura-Mazda, This profit will also be bestowed on you, through Vohu-manç and Asha.

3217.text: Wisdom has Kavâ-Vîstâçpa acquired as a mighty kingdom, Which, with the words of Vohu-manô, with purity, formed The Holy Ahura-Mazda, may we (also) learn them.||

3218.text: May Frashaŏätra Hvô-gvâ show me the beloved bodies, For the law may he in goodness give his beloved (daughter).¶ Mighty is Ahura-Mazda, lay hold on Him to desire after purity.

3219.text: This wisdom, Déjâmaçpa-Hvô-gvâ, the brightness of the wish,** They desire with purity, who know this kingdom of Vohu—mano. Give me, Ahura, that which conduces to Thy joy.

3220.text: To this man, Maidyomâonhâ,* the holy, is (reward) to be given, For the law which he taught the world with desire, (He who) to the creatures of Mazda has through his works announced the best of life.

3221.text: This profit must ye grant us, all ye compliant: Purity, the prayer of Vohu-manô, in which wisdom lays. (Ye) to whom it is offered with prayer, ye who desire the

3222.text: He is the holy man of -wisdom, according to knowledge, words, and deeds. (To whom) according to the law, holy purity through Vohu-manô, the kingdom Ahura-Mazda has given, to this pray we for his good blessing,

3223.text: Through whose offering to me from purity the best (comes), That knows Mazda-Ahura (as well as) those who were and are, To these I offer according to their names, and approach them with friendship.

3224.text: The good men and women of the whole world of purity, praise I,

3225.text: Of the being, the having been, the about to be,

3226.text: Ashis (vanuhi), the coming, the long wished for. ‡

3227.text: The everlasting female-eompanion,§ the self-attaching,|| the everlasting female-companion, the instructing,

3228.text: Who brings hither all remedies for the water, cattle, and trees.

3229.text: Who torments all the tormentings, of the Daevas and men,

3230.text: So that they do not wound this dwelling, the lord of the dwelling.

3231.text: And the good gifts (praise I), the good alms,

3232.text: The good former, ¶ the later,** coming, long wished for,

3233.text: That there may flow to us the greatest and fairest blessings,

3234.text: For the offering, praise, eatisfaction, and land of the Amĕsha-Çpĕntas.

3235.text: For the advancement of this dwelling, for the advancement of the whole world of purity,

3236.text: For resistance to the whole world of evil.

3238.text: The best wish will be uttered of Zarathustra The holy, if to him perhaps favour might grant Out of purity, Ahura-Mazda : the welfare of the soul for ever And those who deceive him, as disciples of the good law, with words and works.

3239.text: May they learn from him with thoughts, words, and works, Wisdom for Mazda, prayer for believing offering. Kava-Vîstâçpa, the Zarathustrian, and the holy Frashaŏstra,

3240.text: These mayest thou too Paouruchiçta. † related to Haêchat-açpa, Holy, worthy of adoration among the daughters of Zarathustra, (Whom) with agreement of Vohu-manô and Asha, Mazda has given thee for a lord,

3241.text: “ Thus for him, yours, will I be zealous, and choose that he may give the fathers As relationship for the active, as pure ancestors For the pure. May I possess the shining, perfect understanding of Vohu-manô, (Which) Mazda created for the good law for ever.” §

3242.text: To you, the Maiden, speak T the words, The marriageable,|| I, the Bridegroom, this encourages me; Learn to know, after this law, the place of Vohu-manŏ, With purity may one of you clothe the other, that will give him ¶ great joy.

3243.text: So are both these manifest, ye men and ye women,

3244.text: That will be your reward for the great deed :

3245.text: Away may be the deceivers, away to the evil-doers.

3246.text: Through evil belief are brought hurts, wounds to thy teachers,

3247.text: May the desirable obedience come hither, for joy to the men and women of Zarathustra,

3248.text: For joy to Vohu-manô, may he grant the reward to be desired according to the law.

3249.text: I wish the good purity of the pure. Great be Ahura-Mazda !

3250.text: The whole world : bodies together with bonea, vital power and form, strength and consciousness, soul and Fravashi,*

3251.text: We give and make known. We make them known: to the holy Gâthâs, the lords over the times, the pure.

3252.text: Which Gâthâs are ruling and protecting for us., heavenly food.

3253.text: Which are for our soul both : food and raiment.

3254.text: These Gâthâs it is who govern and protect ua, our heavenly food.

3255.text: These Gâthâs are for our soul both; food and raiment. †

3256.text: May they bring us good reward, much reward, pure reward,

3257.text: For the next world, after the separation, of the vital power3 and consciousness.

3258.text: May they to us as strength, as victory,

3263.text: As offering ; may they for those who know ‡

3264.text: Come to light, the praiseworthy prayers, as Ahura-Mazda has created them,

3265.text: The Most Profitable, Victorious, the Furtherer of the world,

3266.text: And for the whole world of purity. Give to every pure one who comes hither with this distinguished sheltering prayer, good thoughts, words, and actions.

3267.text: Asha and Vohu(-manô) praise we. The holy Gâthâs, the lords over the times, praise we.

3268.text: The laudable prayers praise we, the creations of the first world. §

3269.text: Whilst we recite them from memory, act thereafter, learn them, teach them, keep them in memory, desire to remind ourselves of them.

3270.text: Whilst we utter them, praise them, with intent to further the world.

3271.text: We praise the division of the laudable prayers,

3272.text: And the reciting, uttering, singing, and praising the praise-worthy prayers.

3273.text: May hearing here have place, for praise to Ahura-Mazda, the Most Profitable, Pure, Who is desired by us from the beginning even to the end.

3274.text: Thus: may hearing here have place for the praise of Ahura-Mazda, the Most Profitable, Pure, Who is desired by us.

3275.text: May hearing here have place for the praise of the good waters, and the Fravashis of the pure, which are desired by us, (and) for the souls, from the beginning even to the end.

3276.text: Thus : May hearing here have place for the praise of the good waters, and the Fravashis of the pure, which are desired by us, (and) for the souls.

3277.text: May hearing here have place for the praise of the good waters, as the male and female good Amê;sha-çpê;ntas, the good Rulers, the wise, for praise to the good things of Ashis-vanuhi, who is bound with purity, for our perfection and uplifting.†

3278.text: May hearing here have place for the praise of the good waters, good, uplifted, ‡ from the beginning to the end.

3279.text: Thus : may hearing here have place for the praise of the good waters, of the male and female Amê;sha-çpĕntas, the good Rulers, the wise, for the praise of the good things of Ashis-vanuhi, who is bound with purity, for our perfection and uplifting.

3280.text: May hearing here have place, good, uplifted for praise for the good waters, from the beginning to the end.

3281.text: Khshnaôthra § for the praise, adoration, satisfaction, and laud of the holy Çraŏsha, the strong, whose body is the Mańthra, whose weapon is uplifted, the Ahurian.

3282.text: Craŏsha the holy, beautiful, victorious, furtherer of the world, the pure, lord of purity, praise we,

3283.text: Who first among the creatures of Ahura-Mazda with Barĕçma bound together

3284.text: Offered to Ahura-Mazda, offered to the Amĕsha-çpĕntas,

3285.text: Offered to the Protector and the Maintainer,* Who created all creatures.

3289.text: Craŏsha, the holy, with Zaǒthras and Ashis-vanuhi, the great, and Nairyô-çanha, the beautiful.

3290.text: May the victorious, holy Craǒsha come to us, to protect us.

3291.text: We praise the holy Craǒsba, the Great Lord praise we, Ahura-Mazda,

3292.text: Who is the Highest in purity, the Most Helpful in purity.

3293.text: All Zarathustrian words praise we, all well-done deeds praise we, done, and such as will in future be done.

3294.text: 1. Craǒsha the holy, beautiful, victorious, the furtherer of the world, the pure, lord of purity, praise we,

3295.text: Who first bound together the Barĕma,

3296.text: Three twigs, five twigs, seven twigs, nine twigs.†

3297.text: As far as the knee, as far as the middle of the feet, for the Amĕsha-çpĕntas, for praise, adoration, satisfaction and laud.

3299.text: 1. Craŏsha , the holy, beautiful, victorious, furtherer of the world, the pure, lord of purity, praise we,

3301.text: As holy prayer, as text, together with commentary, and imprecations,§

3302.text: For praise, for prayer, satisfaction, and laud of the Amĕaha-cpĕntas,

3305.text: Who (is) a firm well-chambered dwelling for the poor men and women, after the rising of the sun ; who smites Aêahma with levelling blow a hard sore.†

3306.text: Who, while he smiles him, breaks his head, for him who despises his strength.‡

3309.text: The strong, swift, mighty, terrible, heroic, very deadly, §

3310.text: Who goes forth from all fights victoriously smiting,

3314.text: The strongest among the youths, the firmest among the youths, the most lusty among the youths, the swiftest among the youths, who first among the youths accomplishes deeds.

3315.text: Desire, 0 Mazdayacnians, for the offering of the holy Çraŏsha ,

3316.text: Far from this dwelling, far from this clan, far from this confederacy, far from this region, shall the bad, pernicious hind-rances be driven away.

3317.text: In whose dwelling the holy victorious Craŏsha receives nourishment, there is also the man pure, thinks much good, speaks much good, and does good.

3320.text: Who smites the vicious man, the vicious || woman, who smites the Daevi Drukhs, the very mighty, the world-destroying,

3321.text: Who is the supporter, the furtherer of all worldly advancement,

3322.text: Who without sleeping preserves with watchfulness the creatures of Mazda, who without sleeping protects with watchfulness the creatures of Ahura-Mazda,

3323.text: Who protects with upraised weapon the whole corporeal world, after the rising of the sun,

3324.text: Who no more sleeps softly since the two Heavenly Beings have created the world : Cpĕnta-mainyus and Anra-(mamyus),

3325.text: Because he will protect the world of purity.

3326.text: Who all days and nights wars with the Mazanian Daevas,
