3328.text: But before whom, of necessity* all the Daevas bow affrighted, basten affrighted to darkness.

3331.text: Whom Ha0ŏma praised, the furtherer, the healing, fair, kingly, having golden eyes,

3332.text: On the highest summit of the high mountain,

3333.text: He who speaks well, speaks protecting words, speaks at the suitable time,

3334.text: Who possesses greatness of all kinds : perfect wisdom, the priority of the Mauthra.†

3337.text: Whose victorious dwelling is formed with a thousand pillars,

3338.text: On the highest top of the great mountain,

3339.text: Shining inwardly with its own light, star-like outwardly,

3340.text: For whom the Ahuna-vairya has given itself as a weapon, and the victorious Yaçna-haptanhâiti,

3341.text: And the victorious Fshûsha-manthra, and all portions of the Yacna.

3344.text: Through whose strength, whose victory, whose good stroke‡ and knowledge, these Amĕsha-çpcntas (rule) over the earth, consisting of seven Kareshvares, who is the law-giver for the laws,

3345.text: Who as unbounded Ruler steps along over the corporeal world. Through this law are gracious to him Ahura-Mazda,

3346.text: Yohu-manô, Asha-vahista, Khshathra-vairya, Cpnta-àrma-itis, Haurvat and Ameretât, the Ahurian Question, the Ahurian Custom,

3347.text: In both worlds, the corporeal and the spiritual.

3348.text: Mayest thou against death rushing hither, Aêshma rushing hither, against the hosts rushing hither,

3349.text: Who uplift the terrible banners before the runners § of Aeshma, whom the evil-knowing Aêshma lets run, together with Vidhotus, created by the Daevas,

3350.text: Grant us strength, O Craŏsha , holy, beautiful, for the horses, but health of the body,

3351.text: Perfect subjection of the tormentors, killing against the evilsouled,

3352.text: Destruction for the foes, the hostile, hating.

3355.text: Whom four horses carry, spotless, bright-shining, beautiful, holy, wise, swift, obeying heavenly commands.

3356.text: Of lead are their hoofs, gold is wrought therein,

3357.text: They are swifter than the horses, swifter than the wind, swifter than the storms,* swifter than the clouds, swifter than the birds with good wings, swifter than the well-aimed arrow (?), all these they overtake.

3358.text: If one hastens behind them one overtakes them not, who hastens forward with two-fold strokes, carrying the good Çraŏsha , the holy.†

3359.text: What is in the Eastern Indies he seizes, what is in the Western he smites.

3362.text: Who great (in form), high-girt, abides among the creatures of Mazda.

3363.text: Who thrice in each day, in each night, decends upon this Kareshvare Qaniratha,

3364.text: Holding a weapon in the hand, the axe of a wood-cutter, which of itself strikes against the head of the Daevas,

3365.text: To smite the wicked Anra-mainyus, to smite Aêshma with the terrible weapons, to smite the Mazanian Daevas, to smite all Daevas.

3368.text: Here and elsewhere, and here also afterwards on the whole earth, we wholly praise Çraŏsha , the holy, strong, whose body is the Mahthra.

3369.text: The strong, capable-of-bearing arms, who possesses strength in the arms, has the strength of a warrior, smites the head of the Daevas.

3370.text: Who accomplishes victorious strokes, and gives victorious strokes to the pure, who smite victoriously—victoriousness which springs from above.

3371.text: (The victoriousness) of the holy Craŏsha and Arsti, worthy of adoration,

3372.text: All dwellings protected by Craŏsha praise we,

3373.text: Where the holy Craŏsha accepts as a beloved friend, where there are pure men who think, speak, and do much good. 8. Through whose Brightness, etc.

3374.text: This profit, this victory give we : namely, the prayer which has a good seed.

3375.text: Which is united with purity, united with wisdom,

3376.text: Whose seeds are good thoughts, words, and works.

3377.text: May this prayer protect against torment from the Daevas and the (bad) men.

3378.text: To this prayer we make known : to protect property and body, to shelter, to rule, to oversee.

3379.text: In prayer we rejoice, Ahura-Mazda, in prayer we desire,

3380.text: To prayer we submit ourselves, on prayer we call,

3381.text: To protect property and body, to shelter, to rule, to control,

3382.text: (Inclusive of) prayer as for such as Thee. (Whoso) is fruitful, pure, victorious, (his) fruits we desire to inherit.

3383.text: 0 Father over the cattle, and over those who belong to the Holy One : the pure, and those wishing purity in the world.*

3384.text: Thou open Giver of good! Whose greatness, goodness, and beauty amongst you we desire.

3385.text: May he shelter us, the rich in goods, control us with purity,† with activity, with liberality, with knowledge, with gentleness, with the tire of Ahura-Mazda.

3386.text: As you created us, 0 Amĕsha-cpĕnta, so support us.

3387.text: Support us ; good men, support us: good women, support us, Amĕsha-cpĕnta, good Ruler, wise.

3388.text: I know no one save you, ye pure ; therefore support us.

3389.text: Thoughts, words and works, cattle and men, commit we to Cpenta-mainyu.

3390.text: All cattle, the healthful goods, the healthful cattle, the healthful men, all healthful pure.

3391.text: All the creatures of the Creator would we, together with the created lights of Ahura-Mazda, keep.*

3392.text: Praise to thee, fire (son) of Ahura-Mazda, mayest thou come hither to the greatest of affairs.†

3393.text: Give us for great friendship, for great delight, Haurvat and Ameretat.

3394.text: We praise the whole composition of the Ctaŏta-Yacnya.

3395.text: With the highest prayer inform we Thy body, the fairest among bodies, Mazda-Ahura,

3396.text: Among these lights the highest of the uplifted, that which is called the Sun.

3397.text: We praise the Ctaŏta-Yacnya, the creations of the first world.

3399.text: The good, mighty, § etc., from Gayo-marathan to the victorious Caoshyanc.

3400.text: The victory, created by Ahura, praise we : Caoshyanc the victorious, praise we.

3401.text: This Barĕcma, provided with Zaŏthra, with binding, bound together with purity, praise we.

3402.text: Our own souls praise we, our own Fravashis praise we.

3403.text: All pure Yazatas praise we, all lords of purity praise we.

3404.text: At the time Hâvani, at the time Cavauhi and Vicya, at the time Vicpé-mazista.

3405.text: "Good art thou, || mayest thou maintain that which is still better than the good.

3406.text: "Since thou fittest thyself worthily as a Zaŏta.

3407.text: "Mayest thou receive the reward which is earned by the Zaŏta,

3408.text: "As one who thinks, speaks, and does, much good."

3409.text: May that come to you which is better than the good, may that not come to you which is more evil than the evil, may that not come to me which is more evil than the evil.

3410.text: The Ahuna-vairya praise we.—Asha-vahista praise we, the fairest Amĕsha-cpĕnta.—The Fshusha-manthra-hadhaokhta praise we. The whole composition of the Ctaŏta-yacnya praise we, the creations of the first world,

3411.text: May that man obtain the best, Who teaches us to know the right path to profit For this world, the bodily as well as for the spiritual The manifest away to the worlds where Ahura ia enthroned, And the offerer, like Thee, a wise, holy one, O Mazda !

3412.text: May there now come to this dwelling, contentment, blessing, guilelessness, and wisdom of the pure. May there appear for this clan : Purity, dominion, profit, majesty, and brightness,

3413.text: Long dominion of the law, the Ahurian, Zarathustrian.

3414.text: Quickly may cattle arise out of this clan,

3415.text: Quickly purity, quickly the strength of the pure man,

3417.text: May there come hither the good, strong, holy Fravashis of the pure, bound with the remedies of purity, according to the breadth of the earth, the length of a river, the height of the Sun, with desire after good things, for withstanding against the foes, for increase for riches and brightness.

3418.text: May Craŏsha (obedience) in this dwelling smite disobedience, peace dissension,* liberality avarice, wisdom slighting, truthful speech the lie, which hates purity.

3419.text: That here the Amĕsha-cpĕntas may be able to wish from the holy Craŏsha :

3420.text: Good offering and prayer, good offering and prayer,†

3421.text: Good maintenance, fortunate maintenance, friendly help,

3422.text: That they may long remain supported.

3423.text: Never may the brilliant Majesty ‡ be extinguished for this dwelling,

3424.text: Not the brilliant richea,not the bright heavenly descendants,

3425.text: By the long (continual) friendship of him who teaches to know brightness, and Ashis-vanuhi,

3426.text: According to wish mayest Thou Ahura-Mazda, etc.§

3427.text: That joyful may be our mind, happy our souls

3428.text: Endued with brilliant bodies for Paradise,

3429.text: So may there openly come hither, 0 Ahura-Mazda, the best purity, the fairest purity.

3430.text: May we see Thee, attain to Thee, to Thy perfect friendship.

3431.text: We praise the Ahima-vairya, on earth and in heaven.

3432.text: We praise the Asha-vahista on earth and in heaven.

3433.text: We praise the Yenhe-hâtaûm, the well-praised, on earth and to heaven.

3434.text: We praise the pious, good blessing, of the pious, pure man, on earth and in heaven.

3435.text: To strive against, to drive away Anra-mainyus, who is provided with creation, with evil creation, who is full of death,

3436.text: To withstand, to drive away the wicked,* male and female.

3437.text: To withstand, to drive away the wicked, the female-wicked.

3438.text: To strive against, to drive away the evil-doers, male and female.

3439.text: To strive against, to drive away the evil-doers, the female evil-doers.

3440.text: To withstand, to drive away thieves and robbers.

3441.text: To withstand, to drive away wizards and magicians.

3442.text: To withstand, to drive away those who harm Mithra, lie to Mithra.

3443.text: To withstand, to drive away those who slay the pure, torment the pure.

3444.text: To withstand, to drive away the very hurtful impure spoiler, who is full of death.

3445.text: To withstand, to drive away every wicked one, who thinks, speaks, and acts unbecomingly. 0 holy Zarathustra,

3446.text: How shall we drive away the Drukhs from here, how shall we, O ye Profitable, drire away the Drukhs, how smite them, as mighty the powerless, † away from all seven Kareshvares ?

3447.text: To withstand, to drive away the whole evil creation, praise (to these) with purity, thou wise, and (to you) ye who exist.

3448.text: Offering and praise, good nourishment, fortunate nourishment, helpful nourishment, I vow to thee, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda.

3449.text: To thee it is to bo offered, thou art to be praised, mayest thou (continually) be provided with offering and praise, in the dwellings of man.

3450.text: Hail to the man who continually offers to thee,

3451.text: Holding firewood in the hand, holding Barĕcma in the hand, holding flesh in the hand, holding the mortar in the hand.

3452.text: Mayest thou continually obtain right firewood, ‡ right fragrance, right nourishment, right increase.

3453.text: Mayest thou be in complete aliment, in good aliment, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda.

3454.text: Mayest thou bnrn in this dwelling, ever mayest thou burn in this dwelling, mayest thou be in brightness in this dwelling, mayest thou be in increase in this dwelling ;

3455.text: Throughout the long time,* until the perfect resurrection, the perfect good resurrection included.

3456.text: Give me, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda,

3457.text: Swift brightness, swift nourishment, swift blessings of life,

3458.text: Greatness in holiness, fluency for the tongue, but for the soul sense and understanding, which afterwards increases, not diminishes,—then manly courage,†

3459.text: Activity, sleeplessness the third part of the night, easy going, watchfulness,

3460.text: Well-nourished, heavenly posterity, which makes a circle, ‡ collects itself together,

3461.text: Which grows up, is enduring, pure from crime, and manly,

3462.text: Which can help me in the house, in the clan, in the con-federacy, in the region, in the district. §

3463.text: Give me, 0 fire son of Ahura-Mazda, what instructs me now and for all time concerning the best place of the pure, the shining, wholly brilliant.

3464.text: May I attain good reward, good renown, good sanctification, for the soul.

3465.text: With all speaks the fire, Ahura-Mazda's (son),

3466.text: For whom he shines throughout the night, and cooks food, ||

3467.text: From all desires he good nourishment, healthful nourishment, helpful nourishment,

3468.text: All who come, the fire looks at their hands,

3469.text: (Saying), "What brings the friend to the friend, the one who comes hither to the one who sits alone ?"

3470.text: We praise the holy fire, the strong, the warrior.

3471.text: If one brings hither for the same, wood, Barĕçma which is bound together in holiness, or the tree Hadha-naopata,

3472.text: Then blesses the fire (the eon) of Ahura-Mazda,

3474.text: “May there arise around thee herds of cattle, abundance of men."

3475.text: "May it go according to the desire of thy spirit, according to the desire of thy soul."

3476.text: "Be glad, live thy life,* the whole time that thou wilt live." This is the blessing of the fire

3477.text: For him who brings it dry Sre-wood, sought for burning, purified in the wish after purity.

3478.text: What to me from Purity, etc.†

3480.text: Abura-Mazda, the Pure, Lord of purity, praise we. The Amĕsha-cpĕntas, the good kings, the wise, praise we.

3481.text: We praise the water, etc. The souls and Fravashis of the pure praise we.§

3482.text: To the support of the pure world they go forwards, etc. ||

3483.text: Whoso, 0 Mazda, spreads abroad the Manthra-word, etc.¶

3484.text: I praise the water: Ardvi-cura,** the pure,

3485.text: The full-flowing, healthful, averse to the Daevas, devoted to the faith in Ahura,

3486.text: The praiseworthy for the corporeal world, the worthy of adoration for the corporeal world,

3487.text: The pure for those which further life, the pure for those which further the cattle,

3488.text: The pure for the furtherers of the world, the pure for the furtherers of the kingdom,

3489.text: The pure for the furtherers of the region,

3490.text: Which purifies the seed of all men,

3491.text: Which purifies the body of all women for delivery, ††

3492.text: Which grants to all women easy deliveries,‡‡

3493.text: Which brings to all women fit and suitable milk,

3495.text: Which is as great as all the (other) waters which hasten away on this earth,

3497.text: From Hukairya the lofty, down to the sea Vouru-Kasha.

3498.text: All (rivers) flow into the boundary-sea Vouru-Kasha, every one flows into the midst of the same.

3499.text: From whence has made them flow out, has poured them out, Ardvî-çûra the pure,

3500.text: Who has a thousand canals, a thousand channels,

3501.text: Each of these canals, each of these channels, is forty days' journey (long), for a well-mounted man.

3502.text: The flowing of this my water alone comes to all the seven Kareshvares.

3503.text: It brings from this my water alone continually thither, in summer as in winter.

3504.text: This my water purifies the seed of men, the body of women, the milk of women,

3505.text: The living, those who have been, the born, the unborn.

3506.text: May the Fravashis of the pure come hither, who have led them (the waters) against the stream from the nearest water hither.

3507.text: May our water not appertain to him who thinks, speaks, or does evil, or to the unbelievers,

3508.text: Not to him who torments the friend, torments the companion, torments the neighbour, torments the relation.

3509.text: May our good, best water, created by Mazda, pure, not be helpful to him

3510.text: Who seeks to injure our uninjured goods.

3511.text: May our good, best water, created by Mazda, pure, not be helpful to him

3512.text: Who seeks to harm our unharmed bodies, who is a thief, a robber, a criminal, a murderer of a pure man,

3513.text: Who is a wizard, or one who buries the dead, a foe, a miser, or a wicked sinner.

3514.text: What man is evil, hostilely minded, him may plagues light on.

3515.text: With destructive intent (may she come to him) who is here, destructively may she come to him who is there.‡

3516.text: Water, rejoice yourself in your places, as long as the Zaŏta offers.

3517.text: How shall the Zaŏta with learnt speech, § offer to the good waters ?

3518.text: How shall his tongue be hound, when he offers in improper manner?

3519.text: How shall the words arrive which the Aethra-paiti has taught him ?

3520.text: How shall the prayers, the invocations,**the offerings take place,

3521.text: Which Ahura-Mazda has taught to Zarathustra, Zara-thustra to the corporeal world ?

3522.text: First pray the waters, O Zarathustra, that they may come hither, then bring us of the water Zaŏthra pure, filtered with prayer.

3524.text: 0 water, I desire from you happiness, grant me the great (happiness), through whose granting, gift of good, freedom from harm takes place.

3525.text: Water, I pray you for goods of many kinds, mighty,

3526.text: Mighty posterity, as many wish it.

3527.text: No one wishes himself this for harm,

3528.text: Not for trouble, not for death, not for revenge, not for destruction.

3529.text: For that pray I the water, for that the earth, for that the trees,

3530.text: For that the Amĕsha-çpĕntas, the good kings, the wise, the good men and women, the givers of good.

3531.text: For that the Fravashis of the pure, the strong,

3532.text: For that (thee), 0 Mithra, with wide pastures,

3535.text: For that (thee), 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda,

3536.text: For that (thee), 0 great lord, possessed of women, Navel of the waters, possessing swift horses,

3537.text: For that all you, 0 Yazatas givers of good things, pure,

3538.text: For that pray I, for myself, the water, etc.†*

3539.text: And for that which is yet greater than this, better than this, of more worth than this.

3540.text: This gives us, ye Yazatas, pure,

3541.text: Whom we wish mighty, and quick, and swift,

3543.text: (To us), the upright doers, that which is the most desired.

3545.text: With purity give I this Zaŏthra, provided with Haŏma, provided with flesh, provided with Hadhâ-naêpata, uplifted with purity,

3546.text: To thee, O Ahurian, § descended from Ahura,

3547.text: For the satisfaction of Ahura-Mazda, of the Amĕsha-çpntas, of the holy Çraŏsha , of the fire (the son) of Ahura-Mazda, of the great lord over purity.

3548.text: With purity give I to the day-times, the lords of purity ; to Havani, the pure, lord of purity.

3549.text: With purity give I to Câvanhi and to Vicya, the pure, lord of purity.

3550.text: With purity give I to Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, has a thousand ears, and ten thousand eyes, a renowned name, the worthy of honour, (and) to Râma-qâctra.

3552.text: With purity give I this Zaŏthra, etc. (Cf. v. 1.)

3553.text: To Thee, Ahurian daughter of Ahura, for satisfaction, etc. †

3554.text: With purity give I, etc., ‡ with purity may he come to us.

3556.text: Thus make we Thee, Ahurian of Ahura, inclined by this.

3557.text: That provided with Haŏma, flesh, and Hadha-naepata, 0 Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura.

3558.text: For sweetness and fatness mayest thou, 0 Zaŏthra, arrive to me : ||

3559.text: Tor health and healing, for help and furtherance, for spreading abroad and hallowing, for renown and good-health of the soul, for victory, and for furthering the world.

3560.text: We praise thee, O Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura, with the Zaŏthras ¶ of good-mindedness.

3561.text: We praise thee, O Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura, with the Zaŏthras of good speech.

3562.text: We praise thee, O Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura, with the Zaŏthras of good works,

3563.text: For the enlightenment of thoughts, words, and works.

3564.text: For purification for the souls, for furthering for the worlds, for preparation for the very pure.

3565.text: Give me, O Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura, the best place of the pure, the shining, wholly brilliant.

3566.text: Give me, OAhurian, (daughter) of Ahura, male, heavenly posterity,

3567.text: Who may further me the dwelling, the clan, the confederacy, the region, the district.*

3568.text: Thee, the Ahurian, we revere, the sea Vôuru-Kasha we revere.

3569.text: All the waters which are on the earth we revere, the standing, the hurrying forwards, the waters in the deeps, those which are in streams, those in hail (?) and in rain.

3571.text: As is your best offering, your best praise, from the best purity.

3572.text: The good best waters, created by Mazda, the pure, we praise.

3573.text: Of the good waters praise we.

3574.text: Their sweetness, their fatness,† praise we,

3575.text: The running water, the water of the growing trees,

3576.text: As an adversary against Azhi created by the Daevas,

3578.text: To withstand, to destroy, to drive away, the hostile tormenting,

3579.text: And the Ashemaŏgha, the impure, smiting, who is full of death.

3580.text: To withstand the plague of the Daevas as of men.

3581.text: Hear our offering, Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura; be content with our offering, Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura.

3582.text: Seat thyself here at our offering.

3583.text: Come to our help for the sake of these many offerings, the-good offerings, for the sake of the good offerings of Zaothras.

3584.text: Whoso offers the good waters to you, 0 Ahurian, (daughter) of Ahura,

3585.text: With the best Zaothras, the Zaothras poured out with prayers,

3586.text: To him belong riches, brightness, to him health of body,

3587.text: To him health of body, victoriousness of body,

3588.text: To him gifts of fortune of much brightness,

3589.text: To him heavenly posterity, to him long, long life,

3590.text: To him the best place of the pure, the shining, wholly brilliant.—

3591.text: Give, 0 good waters to me, the offering of Zaota ;

3592.text: To us the offering Mazdayacnians. the friends, who willingly prepare offering (the disciples),

3593.text: The Herbads, the teachers, men, women, youths, maidens, who act,

3594.text: Who think good, to every one who guards himself from sin, guards against torment, against the hindrances of the hostile hosts,* against the hostile tormentors.

3595.text: The wish and the attainment of the good faith, (the path) which is the most right to the best place, the shining wholly brilliant.—

3596.text: Good dwelling, pleasant dwelling, long dwelling (pray I) for this clan from which spring these Zaŏthras.

3597.text: Good dwelling, pleasant dwelling, long dwelling wish I hither for all Mazdayacnian clans.

3598.text: Good nourishing, healthful nourishing, helpful nourishing, wish I for the fire.

3599.text: Good offering for thee, Ahurian (daughter) of Ahura, pray I.

3600.text: Râma-qactra pray I for this region.

3601.text: Health (and) remedy implore I for you ye pious pure men.

3603.text: Who are good, pure, on earth and in heaven,

3604.text: For a thousand remedies, for ten thousand remedies.

3606.text: So may it come as I entreat.—

3608.text: The good wisdom here, the good holiness,

3610.text: Goods and remedies. The waters we invoke, namely, the good waters of you. Being invoked, do you who are able, give to us riches and brightness.

3611.text: Waters! grant us the happiness that has been already before obtained by you.

3614.text: Praise to Mithra, who possesses many pastures.

3615.text: Praise to the Sun, who is endowed with swift horses.

3616.text: Praise to the two eyes of Ahura-Mazda.§

3617.text: Praise to the Fravashi of the Bull, of Gayo(marathan) of the holy Zarathustra, the pure.

3618.text: Praise to the whole world of purity, which is, has been, and is to be.

3619.text: Increase through Vohu-mano (and) Khshathra-(vairya), with fortunate body.

3620.text: Unto the lights, the most brilliant (lights) of the high,

3621.text: Where Cpĕnta-mainyu at the end will come to thee.

3623.text: The best kingdom, the unbounded, etc. ‡

3624.text: To these I offer, to him draw I near as a friend : to the Amĕsha-çpĕnta3, the good kings, the wise.

3625.text: I lay hold on this God, this Lord we praise : Ahura-Mazda,

3626.text: The Creator, the Rejoicer, the Maker of all good things,

3627.text: This lord we praise : Zarathustra, the holy.

3628.text: That created for us, the pure, ‡

3630.text: Namely, the (creatures) of Ahura-Mazda, of Vohu-mano, of Asha-Vahista.

3631.text: Of Khshathra-vairya, of Cpĕnta-ârmaiti, of Haurvat and Ameretat,

3632.text: Which appertain to the body of the Bull, to the soul of the Bull, to the fire (the son) of Ahura-Mazda.

3633.text: The (creatures) of the holy Çraŏsha , of Rashnu, the most righteous, of Mithra, who possesses wide pastures,

3634.text: Of the pure wind, of the good Mazdayacnian law,

3635.text: Of the good pious blessing, of the good pious blessing against the Drujas, the good pious blessing against the Demons.

3636.text: That we may employ fruitful speech, that we as profitable to the regions

3637.text: May employ profitable speech, that we may be profitable, Tictorious; be friends of Ahura-Mazda; may have vigorous bodies, §

3638.text: As pure men, who think good, speak good, do good,

3639.text: That we may attain through Vohû-mano (good-minded-ness) to rejoice in good things, to obtain them.

3640.text: How shall my soul enjoy the good things, obtain them ?

3641.text: We praise the going forwards and the going backwards of the good waters, and their coming hither.

3642.text: The great lord, possessing women, brilliant, the Navel of the waters, having swift horses, praise we.

3643.text: For the praise, adoration, satisfaction, and laud of the whole world of purity, may hearing find place.

3644.text: Çraŏsha , the holy, praise we. The great Lord praise we, namely Ahura-Mazda,

3645.text: Who is the Highest of purity, the most Helpful of purity.

3646.text: All sayings of Zarathustra praise we. All well-done actions praise we, as well those already done as those which will yet be done.

3647.text: Frashaŏstra asked the holy Zarathustra: Say, 0 first* Zarathustra,

3648.text: Wherein consists the recitation of the Ratus, wherein lies the conclusion of the Gâthâs ?

3649.text: Then answered Zarathustra: Ahura-Mazda the Pure, Lord of purity, praise we.

3650.text: Zarathustra the pure, lord of purity, praise we.

3651.text: The Fravashi of the pure Zarathustra praise we.

3652.text: The Amĕsha-çpĕntas, the pure, praise we.

4126.text: Over the water, as Thou wilt over the trees, as Thou wilt over all good that has a pure origin.

4127.text: Make that the pure may rule, the impure may not rule.

4128.text: May the pure rule as he will, may the godless not rule as they will.

4129.text: May the foe disappear, driven away by the creatures of Çpĕnta-mainyus, conquered, not ruling as he would.

4130.text: I urge, I who am Zarathustra, the first of the families, elans, societies, regions, *

4131.text: To thinking, speaking, and acting, according to this law which originates from Ahura and Zarathustra.

4132.text: The wide extent and brightness of the whole creation of purity, I bless.

4133.text: The narrowness and trouble of the whole evil creation, I Hless.

4134.text: At the time of the morning-dawn came Haǒma to Zarathustra,

4135.text: As he was purifying the fire and reciting the Gâthâs.

4136.text: Zarathustra asked him : Who, 0 man, art thou?

4137.text: Thou, who appearest to me as the most beautiful in the whole corporeal world, endued with Thine own life, majestic, and immortal ?

4138.text: Then answered me Haǒma, the pure, who is far from death.

4139.text: I am, 0 Zarathustra, Haǒma, the pure, who is far from death.

4140.text: Ask me, thou Pure one, make me ready for food.

4141.text: Praise me with songs of praise, as also the other Profitable have praised me.

4142.text: Then spake Zarathustra : Praise be to the Haǒma !

4143.text: Who first, 0 Haǒma, prepared thee in † the corporeal world ? What holiness became thereby his share ? What wish was bestowed on him ?

4144.text: Then answered Haǒma, the pure, who is far from death :

4145.text: Vivanhao2 has first of men in the corporeal world prepared me. This holiness became thereby his portion, this wish was granted to him :

4146.text: That a son was horn to him, Yima, the bright, possessing a good congregation ;

4147.text: The most majestic of beings, who most gazes at the sun among men ;3

4148.text: Since on account of his rule men and cattle were immortal, water and trees not dried up,

4150.text: In the wide rule of Yima there was no cold, no heat,

4151.text: No old age and death, no envy created by the Daevas.

4152.text: Father and son walked along, fifteen years old in countenance, each of the two,

4153.text: So long as Yima of the good rule, the son of Yivańhao, governed.—

4154.text: Who, 0 Haǒma, has prepared thee, as the second man in the corporeal world ? What holiness became thereby bis portion ? What wish was granted to him ?

4155.text: Then answered Haǒma, the pure, who is far from death :

4156.text: Athwya’4 has prepared me as the second man in the corporeal world; this holiness became thereby his portion, this wish was granted to him,

4157.text: That a son was born to him with valiant clan : Thrae-taonô,

4158.text: Who smote the serpent Dahâka, which bad three jaws, three heads, six eyes, a thousand strengths.

4159.text: The very mighty Druj, derived from the Daevas, the bad for the world, the evil,

4160.text: Which Anra-mainyus brought forth as the mightiest Druj in the corpureal world, for the destruction of purity in the world.—

4161.text: Who has prepared thee, 0 Haǒma, aa the third man in the corporeal world ? What holiness became thereby his portion ? What wish was fulfilled to him ?

4162.text: Then answered me Haǒma, the pure, who is far from death :

4163.text: Thrita,5 the most profitable of the Çâmas, has prepared me as the third man in the corporeal world; this holiness became thereby his portion, this wish became fulfilled to him :

4164.text: That two sons were born to him, Urvâkhshya and Kere-çâçpa.

4165.text: The one, a disposer in relation to custom and law ;

4166.text: The other, endued with higher activity, a youth, bearer of the club Gaeçus,

4167.text: Who smote the serpent Çruvara, the poisonous, green, which destroyed horses and men.

4168.text: On which the green poison flowed of the thickness of a thumb ;

4169.text: On which Kereçâçpa cooked his food in a caldron,

4170.text: About the time of mid-day : then it burnt the serpent and he took himself off;

4171.text: Away from the caldron sprang he ; he went hack to the hurrying waters.

4172.text: Backwards fled amazed the bold Kereçâçpa.5—

4173.text: Who has prepared thee, 0 Haǒma, as the fourth man in the corporeal world ? What holiness became thereby his portion? What wish was fulfilled to him ?6

4174.text: Then answered me Haŏma, the pure, who is far from death :

4175.text: Pourualiàçpa7 has prepared me as the fourth man in the corporeal world, this holiness became thereby his portion, this wish was fulfilled to him :

4176.text: That Thou wert born to him, thou pure Zarathustra,8 in the dwelling of Pourushâçpa, created against the Daevas, devoted to the belief in Ahura,

4177.text: The renowned in Airyana-vaêjo. Thou, as the first, 0 Zarathustra, hast recited the Ahuna-vairya, which spreads itself abroad fourfold,9

4179.text: Thou madest that all the Daevas hid themselves in the earth, 0 Zarathustra, which before were going about on the earth in the shape of men.

4180.text: Thou, the mightiest, strongest, most active, swiftest, the most victorious amongst the heavenly beings.

4277.text: Who thinks to calumniate the Âthrava and the Haŏma, who when it has calumniated disappears.

4279.text: To five I belong, to five I belong not.

4282.text: I belong to those who do good ; to those who do evil I belong not.

4283.text: I belong to those who hear, not to those who hear not.15

4284.text: I belong to the pure, not to the bad.

4286.text: Then spake Zarathustra : Praise to the Haŏma, created by Mazda! Good is Haŏma, created by Mazda! Praise to the Haŏma !

4287.text: All Haŏmas praise I, which are found on the tops of the mountains, and in the abysses of the valleys, aud which are kept in the defiles, in the bands of the Jainis.

4288.text: I pour from the silver cup into the golden.17

4289.text: May I spill nothing of thee upon the earth, since thou hast so high a value.

4291.text: These are thine enjoyments,18 these the right-spoken speeches.

4314.text: I am not the chief of sinners, I, Haŏma, who is far from death.

4322.text: Then spake Zarathustra : praise to the Haŏma, the created by Mazda ! Good is Haŏma, the created by Mazda! Praise to the Haŏma !

4474.text: Zarathustra asked Ahura-Mazda : Ahura-Mazda, Heavenlv, Holiest, Creator of the corporeal world, Pure !

4475.text: Which was the speech, 0 Ahura-Mazda, that Thou hast spoken to me,

4476.text: As (being) before the heaven, before the water, before the earth, before the Bull, before the trees, before the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, before the pure men, before the Daevas with perverted soul, and before mankind, before the whole corporeal world, before all the good thinga created by Mazda, which have a pure origin?2

4477.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda : This portion3 of the Ahuna-Vairya it was, 0 holy Zarathustra, which I have taught thee:

4478.text: (As being) before the heaven, before the water, before the earth, before the Bull, before the trees, before the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, before the pure men, before the Daevas who are of perverted soul, and before mankind, before the whole corporeal world, before all the good things created by Mazda, which have a pure origin.

4479.text: This portion of the Ahuna-vairya, 0 holy Zarathustra, recited without omission, without negligence,

4480.text: Is worth a hundred other meritorious Gâthâs, which are recited with omission and negligence.4

4481.text: (Even) recited with omission, with negligence, it is equal to ten other principal prayers.

4482.text: Whoso in this corporeal world, 0 holy Zarathustra, utters to me the portion of the Ahuna-vairya, recites uttering, delivers reciting, praises delivering,5

4483.text: Ilia soul bring I thrice over the bridge to Paradise, I who am Ahura-Mazda,6

4484.text: Unto the best place, unto the best purity, unto the best lights,

4485.text: But whoso in this corporeal world mutilates this portion of the Ahuna-vairya to me in the recitation, 0 holy Zarathustra,

4486.text: Be it the half, the third, the fourth, or even the fifth,7

4487.text: His soul take I, I who am Ahura-Mazda, away from the Best place.

4488.text: So far as the length and breadth of this earth ; now this earth is as broad as long.

4489.text: This word have I spoken, that possessing lord and ruler,8 before the creation of this heaven,

4490.text: Before the water, before the earth, before the trees,

4491.text: Before the creation of the four-footed bull,

4492.text: Before the birth of the pure man, the two-legged,

4494.text: I have spoken it (the Ahuna-vairya) out of heavenly holiness,

4495.text: For the whole world of purity, the existing, already in being, and the future,

4496.text: As an example of the works in the world of Mazda.9

4497.text: This is the praiseworthy of prayers, of those which I have spoken, do speak, and which are to be spoken.

4498.text: This is as praiseworthy as the whole corporeal world besides.

4499.text: Let the learner learn it; if he retains it, so he gains the victory (thereby) over dying.10

4500.text: This speech was taught for us, for every being, to learn and to meditate, on account of the best purity.11

4502.text: He who recognizes Him as Lord and Master, who teaches Him, Ahura-Mazda, to the creatures, who are the first in understanding.12

4503.text: He who resigns himself to Him, the Greatest of all, he teaches also His creatures to know Him as the Greatest.

4504.text: As he (declares) enjoyment in Mazda, whilst he utters the third paragraph, vanhéus dazda mananhô,—thus he gives himself to the spirit.13

4506.text: If he teaches it to the beings, 0 Mazda, thus ho becomes as its beings.

4509.text: All the words which are uttered, every word springs from Ahura-Mazda.

4510.text: The Best Ahura-Mazda has spoken the Ahuna-vairya, the Best has made it perfect.

4511.text: Swiftly went the bad away, when it was spoken against the bad.

4512.text: On account of this utterance against them

4513.text: May they (the bad spirits) neither to our souls, nor teaching, nor to our understanding,

4514.text: Nor to our faith, nor to our prayers, nor to actions,

4515.text: Nor to our law, nor to our souls, adhere.

4516.text: This speech which Ahura-Mazda has spoken contains three heads, four professions, five rulers, it ia brought to the end through the offering.16

4517.text: Which are the heads ? To think, speak, and do good.

4518.text: hich the professions ? Priests, warriors, husbandmen, and artizans.17

4519.text: All renown unites itself with the pure man through true thinking, speaking, and acting ;

4520.text: As it is taught by the lord according to the teaching of the law.

4521.text: Through his deeds the worlds increase in purity.18

4523.text: Of the regions which are without the Zarathustrian realm, the Zarathustrian Ragha has four lords.

4524.text: What are the lords of these? The lord of the dwelling, the lord of the clan, the lord of the confederacy, Zarathustra as the fourth.19

4525.text: What is well thought? Purity, by the beings first in understanding.

4527.text: What well done? (What is done) with hymns by the beings first in purity.20

4528.text: Ahura-Mazda has spoken (the Ahuna-vairya), to whom has he spoken ? To the pure in heaven and in the world.

4529.text: In what capacity has he spoken the speech? As best king.

4530.text: To whom ? To the best pure, not ruling at will.

4531.text: Ahura-Mazda spake : “ Ashem vôhû vahistem açtî.” He gives to him thereby the best good (vôhû-vahistem), namely, for himself his own existeuce, if he fulfils the law which lies in vôhûvahistem açti.*

4532.text: Ustâ açtî ustâ ahmâi (whilst he speaks these words), he gives what is good, for every pure all purity, namely, all the purity which belongs to every single mau gives he to every pure one.†

4533.text: Hyat ashâi vahistâi ashem. (Thereby) gives he the whole Manthra to him who knows the Mahthra.

4534.text: He entrusts dominion to the pure.

4535.text: To the praying pure one gives he purity.

4536.text: To you, the Profitable, gives he purity : three maxims.

4537.text: The whole speech is of Ahura; it is wholly the speech of Ahura-Mazda.

4538.text: Ahura-Mazda has uttered the speech ; to whom has he spoken it? To the pure, the heavenly, and the earthly.

4539.text: In what quality has he uttered the speech ? As the Best Ruling.

4540.text: To whom (in what quality to be found) ? To the pure, not ruling according to will.

4541.text: (It is) the praiseworthy speech of the pure Zarathustra : Yĕnhê hâtanm àat yêçnê paiti.—Yêiihé (to whom), with this brings he praise to Mazda, who, according to the law of Ahura— Hâtahm (to the existing) lie offers praise,

4542.text: Namely, to those of the existing who desire to be friendly, To all pure (women), brilliant in understanding, he offers praise.§

4543.text: Namely, for praise for the Immortal. Here are three sentences in the whole praiseworthy speech. To whom is the invocation addressed ? To the Amĕsha-çpĕntas at every offering.

4544.text: Then apake Ahura-Mazda : Hail to each, whoever it may be!

4545.text: May Ahura he made ruling according to will.

4547.text: Happiness has he announced, namely, happiness for every pure one, the existing, having been, and about to he.

Now will we make Him, the greatest of all, our Lord and Master: Ahura-Mazda, in order to smite Anra-mainyus, the evil, to smite Aêshma with horrible weapons, to smite the Mazanian Daevas, to smite all Daevas, also all the Varenian, evil ones, {Broken be Ganâ-mainyo, a hundred thousand times curse upon Ahriman),¶ to advance Ahura-Mazda the Brilliantly Majestic, to advance the Amĕsha-çpëntas, to advance the star Tistrya, the bright and shining, to advance the pure man, to advance all the pure creatures of Çpĕnta-mainyu. Yathâ ahû vairyo (2). The good men, etc. (Yaçna li.)

4693.text: Praise to Thee, Ahura-Mazda, Three-fold before other creatures. Praise to ye, Amĕsha-çpĕntas, who have all like wills with the Sun. May this come to Ahura-Mazda, to the Amesha- çpĕntas, to the Fravashis of the pure, this to the birds, to the Ruler of the long period.*—Contentment (be) for Ahura-Mazda, contempt for Anra-Mainyus (as it) is best according to the will of the well-doers. I praise : Ashem-vohû. I praise with good thoughts, etc. (Yaçna xii.) Ashem-vohû.

4694.text: The immortal Sun, shining, with swift steeds, we praise. Mithra, possessing wide pastures, we honour,—the truth-speaking gatherer, the thousand-eared, well-ahaped, with ten thousand eyes, great, endued with far-watching, the strong, not sleeping, wakeful. Mithra, the lord of all regions, we praise, whom. Ahura-Mazda has created as the most brilliant of the heavenly Yazatas. Therefore come to our assistance: Mithra and Ahura the great. The immortal brilliant Sun, with swift steeds, we praise.—Tistrya, with healthful eyes, we praise (3).— Tistrya we praise. The Stars pertaining to Tistra we praise. Tistrya, the shining, majestic, we praise.—The Star Vanant, created by Mazda, we praise.—The Star Tistrya, the shining, majestic, we praise.—The Heaven, which follows its own law, we praise.—The endless Time we praise.—Time, the ruler of the long Period, we praise.—The holy Wind, the well-created, we praise. he rightest Wisdom, created by Mazda, pure, we praise.The good Mazdayaçnian law we praise.—The acceptableness of the Ways we praise.—The splendid gold-mine we praise.—(The Mountain) Çaokant, created by Mazda, we praise.—All pure heavenly Yazatas we praise—all earthly Yazatas we praise.—We praise our own souls.—We praise our own Fravashi.—Come hither to help me, 0 Mazda !—The good, strong, holy Fravashis of the pure we praise.—The immortal, brilliant Sun, with strong steeds, we praise. Àshem-vohû (3).

4695.text: I confess myself a Mazdayaçnian, a follower of Zarathustra, a foe of the Daevas, devoted to belief in Ahura ; (Morning), To Hâvani, the pure, lord of the pure, for praise, honour, satisfaction, and laud. To Çâvanhi and to Vîçya, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. (Mid-day). To Rapithwina, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. To Frâdat-fshu and to Zantuma, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. (Evening). To Uzayêirina, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. To Frâdat Vira and to Daqyuma, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. To the immortal Sun, shining, with swift steeds (be) Khshnaothra for praise, etc. Yathâ ahû vairyo.

4696.text: The immortal Son, brilliant, with swift horses, we praise. Then, when the Sun shines in brightness, etc.*

4697.text: Ormazd! Lord, Increaser of mankind, of all kinds, all species of men ! May He let all blessings and knowledge, fast faith and the blessings of the good Mazdayaçnian law, come to me. So be it † Yathâ ahû vairyo (2).

4698.text: Offering, praise, might, strength, implore I for the Sun, immortal, brilliant, with swift horses. Asheui-vohu (3). The Ahurian pastures of Ahura praise I, with the best gifts, with the fairest gifts, with gifts which are sought out of prayers.

4699.text: Praise to the Creater of the world, (and) to the created, Satisfaction for Ahura-Mazda, etc. (as above, vii. 1). I praise : Ashem-vohû.

4700.text: Praise to thee, most profitable Ardvî-çûra, spotless, pure, —Ashem-vohû.—Praise to thee, tree, good, created by Mazda, pure,—Ashem-vohû.—The immortal, brilliant Sun, with swift horses, we praise. Ashem-vohû.

4701.text: Praise to Thee, Ahura-Mazda, etc. (as above, vii. 1, 2).

4702.text: I confess (myself) a Mazdayaçnïan, a disciple of Zarathustra, an adversary of the Daevas, devoted to the law of Ahura; to Hâvani, the pure, lord of purity, praise, prayer, satisfaction, and laud ; to Çâvanhi and to Viçya, the pure, lord of Purity, praise, etc. (as above, vii. 3) ; to Mithra, who possesses road pastures, has a thousand ears and ten thousand eyes, and a well-known name, and to Râma-qâçtra, Khshnaöthra, for praise, etc. As is God's will, etc. (p. 10).

4703.text: Mithra, who possesses broad pastures, we praise : the truth- speaking, gathering, thousand-eared, well-formed, provided with ten thousand eyes, great, possessing a wide watch, strong, not sleeping, vigilant.—Mithra, who is set over the regions, praise we.—Mithra, who is within the regions, praise we.—Mithra, who is with these regions, praise we.—Mithra, who is over the regions, praise we.—Mithra, who is below the regions, praise we.—Mithra, who is before the regions, praise we.—Mithra, who is behind the regions, praise we.—Mithra and Ahura, both great, immortal, pure, praise we. The Stars, the Moon and Sun, the trees which produce Barëçma, praise we. Mithra, the lord of all regions, praise we. For his brightness, for his majesty, will I praise him with audible praise: Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, with offerings. Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, we praise ; the pleasant abode, the good abode for the Arian provinces. May he come to us for protection, may he come to us for joy, may he como to us for profit, may he come to us for benevolence, may he come to us for healing, may he come to us for victory, may he come to us for purifying, may he come to us for sanctification. Strong, very mighty, deserving offerings, praiseworthy, not to be lied to in the whole corporeal world, (is) Mithra, who possesses wide pastures. This mighty, worthy of honour, strong, most profitable Mithra of created beings, will I praise with gifts,—I come to him with friendship and prayer, to him will I offer audible praise, to Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, with gifts. "We praise Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, with the Haöma, which is bound, etc.

4704.text: Ormazd, Lord, Jncreaser of all mankind, etc. (see above, vii. 5). Praise, adoration, strength, might, pray I for Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, has a thousand ears, and ten thou-sand eyes, who possesses a named* name, who is worthy of honour, (and) to Èâma-qâçtra. Ashem-vohû.

4705.text: In the name of Ormazd, God, Lord, Inereaser. May the Moon, the purifier', attain to great brightness. May She come (to help). Of all my sins, etc.

4706.text: Praise to Ahura-Mazda, praise to the Amesha-cpcntas, praise to the Moon which contains the seed of the bull, praise to the seen, praise through the beholding (3), Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda (as above, vii. 1), etc. I praise : Ashem-vohû (3).

4707.text: I confess (myself) a Mazdayaçnian, a follower of Zarathustra, a foe of the Daevas, devoted to the law of Ahura : to Aiwiçrûthrema Aibigaya the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. To Fradat-viçpanm-Hujyâiti, and Zarathustrotema the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc. To the Moon, which contains the seed of the Bull, to the only-born Bull, to the Bull of many kinds. Khshnaöthra praise, etc. As it is the Lord's will, etc.

4708.text: Ormazd, Lord, etc. (as in vii. 5). Yathâ ahû vairyo (2). Off'ering, praise, might, strength, implore I for the Moon, which contains the seed of the Bull ; and the only-begotten Bull, and the Bull of many kinds. Ashem-vohŭ.

4709.text: Give strength and victory; give kingdom (?) in flesh. Give an abundance of enduring (?) men, gathering, smiting, who are not smitten, who only smite the foes once, who smite evilwishers once, manifestly assisting him who rejoices them.†

4710.text: Yazatas, endowed with much brightness, Yazatas, very health-bringing! May greatness be manifest from you, manifest from you the profit which follows the invocation. Great I be ye manifest in reference to splendour for the offerers.

4711.text: Adoration to the Creator of the world, (and) to the Creation. Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda, praise to Ahura-Mazda, praise to the Amĕsha-çpĕntas, praise to the Moon, which con tains the seed of the Bull, praise to the seen, praise through the eight. Ashem-vohŭ.

4712.text: Ahnra-Mazda spake to the holy Zarathustra. Praise Her,O holy Zarathuatra, Ardvî-çûra, the pure, full-flowing, healing, averse from the Daevas, etc. (Cf. Yasht 5, 1-7). Whom I, Ahura-Mazda, sustain with good strength, for the advancement of the house, the clan, the confederacy, the district.

4713.text: For whose sake are the praiseworthy offering-prayers: I will recite the Ahuna-vairya, I will recite the Asha-vahista. I will praise the good waters, I will purify with these words taken from the Gâthâs. May Garo-nemâna (and) Ahura-Mazda first come (to me) ; may He thus grant this favour.

4714.text: For her brightness, for her majesty, will I praise her with audible praise, will I praise her with well-offered offerings. Therewith art thou very much called to help, thereby art thou well offered to, Ardvî-çûra, spotless, with offering. We praise Ardvî-çûra, the spotless, pure, mistress of purity, with Haöma, which is bound, etc.

4715.text: Ormazd, Ruler, Increaser of mankind, etc. Yathâ ahû vairyo (2).

4716.text: In the name of God, Ormazd, the Ruler, the Increaser of great majesty. May the Fire Behràm increase (the Fire) Adarfrâ.

4717.text: Purify me, 0 God, give me strength through Ârmaiti. Holiest, Heavenly Mazda, give me at my prayer in goodness, Strong power through Asha, fullness of blessings through Vohû-mand. To teach afar for (Thy) joy give me certainty, That from the kingdom, 0 Ahura, which belongs to the blessings of Vohû-manô. Teach, 0 Çpênta-ârmaiti, the law with purity. Zarathustra gives as a gift the soul from his body.

4718.text: Satisfaction (be) for Ahura-Mazda. Praise be to thee, fire (son) of Ahura-Mazda, giver of good, the greatest Yazata ! Ashem-vohû (3), I confess myself, etc. To the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, to thee, fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, to the fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, to the majesty, the profit created by Mazda ; the brightness of the Arians created by Mazda, the kingly majesty created by Mazda.—To the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, to Kava Huçravahha, to the Vara of Huçravahha, to the mountain Acravanta created by Mazda, to the Vara Chaechaçta created by Mazda, to the kingly majesty created by Mazda.—To the fire the son of Ahura-Mazda, to the mountain Raevanta created by Mazda, to the kingly majesty created by Mazda.—To the fire the son of Ahura-Mazda, Holy fire, warrior, Yazata with much majesty, Yazata with many healing-remedies ! To the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, with all fires. To the Navel of kings, to Nairyo-çanha, worthy of honour. Satisfaction, etc. (Yathâ ahû vairyo).

4719.text: Offering and praise, good nourishment, fortunate nourishment, helpful nourishment, vow I to thee, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda ! To thee is it to be offered, thou art to be praised, inayest thou ever be provided with offering and praise, in the dwellings of mankind. Prosperity † be to the man who continually offers to thee, holding firewood in the hand, holding Barĕ âma in the hand, holding flesh in the hand, holding the mortar in the hand. Mayest thou ever obtain right firewood, right perfume, right nourishment, right augmentation ; mayest thou be in complete nourishment, in good nourishment, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda ; mayest thou burn in this dwelling, mayest thou continually burn in this dwelling, mayest thou be in brightness in this dwelling, mayest thou be in increase in this dwelling, throughout the long time until the complete resurrection, the perfect good resurrection included. Give to me, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, swift brightness, swift nourishment, much brightness, much nourishment, many blessings of life, greatness in holiness, fluency for the tongue, but for the soul sense and understanding, which afterwards increases itself and does not diminish, then manly courage, activity, wakefulness the third part of the night, easy going, increase, well-nourished, heavenly offspring, which forms a circle, gathers itself together, increases, enduring, pure from debt, and manly, which can advance for me the house, the clan, the .confederacy, the region, the district.

4720.text: Give to me, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, that which teaches me now and for all times, concerning the best place of the pure, the shining, very brilliant. May I attain good reward, good fame, good holiness for the soul.—With all speaks the Are, (the son) of Ahura-Mazda, for whom throughout the night it gives light and cooks food ; from all desires it good nourishment, wholesome nourishment, helpful nourishment. To all who come the fire looks afc their hands (saying) : " What does the friend bring to the friend, the entering in to the sitting alone?"

4721.text: We praise the holy fire, the strong, the -warrior. If one brings for the same wood brought in purity, Bareçma bound together in holiness, or the tree Hadhâ-naépata, then blesses the fire (the son) of Ahura-Mazda, contented, without hatred, satisfied : " May there arise round about thee herds of cattle, fullness of men ; may it happen according to the wish of thy mind, according to the wish of thy soul. Be cheerful; live thy life the whole time which thou wilt live." This is the blessing of the fire for him who brings it dry wood, sought for burning, purified with, the wish for purity.*

4722.text: Ormazd, Ruler, etc. Yathâ ahû vairyo (2).

4723.text: Praise to the Creator of the world, (and) to the created. Satisfaction (be) to Ahura-Mazda. Praise to thee, Fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, giver of good, greatest Yazata. Ashem-vohû.

4724.text: May the fire Bahrâm—Adar fra—Adaran—the victorious king Adar Gusasp, Adar Khordat, Adar Burxtn-mihr, (as well as) the other Aderans, the fires which are in Dâdgâh, increase to great brilliancy. May Mainyo-karho,‡ the strong, victorious, increase to great brightness.

4725.text: Praise to thee, 0 fire, son of Ahura-Mazda, Giver of good, greatest Yazata, Ashem-vohû (3). I confess myself, etc. To the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda ; to thee, fire, son of Ahura-Mazda. Satisfaction, etc.

4726.text: Ashem-vohû.—Thee, the fire, lay I hold on with the offering of good thought. Thee, the fire, lay I hold on with the offering of good words. Thee, the fire, lay I hold on with the offering of good works, for the enlightenment of thoughts, words, and works. (Cf. Yaçna xvii. 6-9.)

4727.text: Praise to Thee, Ahura-Mazda, thou who art the Most Profitable, etc. (Cf. Yaçna xxxiii. 11.) Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda, etc. Of good thoughts, etc. (Cf. Yaçna xxxv. 4-6). Purify me, etc. (Yaçna xxxiii. 12-14.) Offering and praise, etc. (Yaçna lxi.) Ashem-vohû. Yathâ ahû vairyo.—Offering, praise, strength, might, etc. (as in xi. 7).

4728.text: All good thoughts, words, and works, are done with knowledge.

4729.text: All evil thoughts, words, and works are not done with knowledge.

4730.text: All good thoughts, words, and works lead to Paradise,

4731.text: All evil thoughts, words, and works lead to hell.

4732.text: To all good thoughts, words, and works (belongs) Paradise—so (is it) manifest to the pure.—Ashem-vohû.

4733.text: In the name of God, the Giver, Forgiver, Rich in Love. Praise be to the name of Ormazd, the God with the name,“Who always was, always is, and always will be.” Çpênta-mainyus, the Heavenly amongst the Heavenly,† with the name,“From whom alone is derived rule.” Ormazd is the Greatest Ruler, Mighty, Wise, Creator, Supporter, Refuge, Defender, Completer of good works, Overseer, Pure, Good, and Just.

4734.text: With all strength (bring I) thanks : to the Great among beings, who created and destroyed,‡ and through His own deter- mination of time* strength, wisdom, is higher than the six Amshaspands, and the many Yazatas, the shining Paradise Garothman, the circumference of Heaven, the shining Sun, the briUiant Moon, the numerous Stars, the wind, the Andervdi,† the water, the fire, the earth, the trees, the cattle, the metals, mankind.

4735.text: Offering and praise to that Lord, the Completer of good works, who made men greater than all earthly beings, and through the gift (?) of speech created them to rule and appoint for the creatures, as warriors against the Daevas.

4736.text: Praise to the Omniscience of God, who hath sent through the holy Zarathustra, with pure Frohar, peace for the creatures, the wisdom of the law — the enlightening derived from the heavenly understanding, and heard with the ears—wisdom and guidance for all beings who are, were, and will be, (and) the wisdom of wisdoms, the Mańthra-çpĕnta, who effects freedom from hell for the soul at the bridge ( Chinvat), and leads it over to that Paradise the brilliant, sweet-smelling of the pure.

4737.text: All good do I accept at Thy command, O God, and think, speak, and do it. I believe in the pure law, by every good work seek I forgiveness for all sins. I keep pure for myself the serviceable work and abstinence (from the unprofitable), (/keep) pure the six powers : thought, speech, work, memory, mind, and understanding. According to Thy will am I able to accomplish, O Accomplisher of good, Thy honour with good thoughts, good words, good works.

4738.text: I enter on the shining way (to Paradise) ; may the fearful terror of hell not overcome me! May I step over the bridge Chinvat, may I attain Paradise with much perfume, and all enjoyments, and all brightness.

4739.text: Praise to the Overseer, the Lord, who rewards those who accomplish good deeds according to (His own) wish, purifies at last the obedient, and, (at last) purifies [even) the wicked out of hell.— All praise be to the Creator Ormazd, the All-wise, Mighty, Rich in might, to the seven Amshaspands, to Ized Bahrâm, the victorious annihilator of foes.

4740.text: Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda. Ashem-vohû, etc.—I confess myself a Mazdayaçnian, a follower of Zarathustra, an adversary of the Daevas, devoted to the belief in Ahura :

4741.text: To Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, has a thousand ears and ten thousand eyes, who has a named ‡ name, who is worthy of honour, and to Râma-qâçtra, satisfaction, etc. As it is the will of God, so let the Zaöta say it to me. (Zaŏta) : Thus proclaims God from holiness, the pure wise words :

4742.text: Hâvani, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Ameretât, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The Ahurian Questions, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The Ahurian Custom, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The strong Yaçna Haptanhaiti, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. (Yaçna lxx. 59-60.)

4743.text: Çavanhi and Vîçya, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Airyama-ishya, the pure, lord of purity, we praise,—the strong, victorious, harmless, destroying all harm, driving away all harm, who is the topmost, middlemost, foremost, to impel (to reading) through the Manthra to the five Gâthâs.

4744.text: And Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, we praise, Eâma-qâçtra we praise, for the praise, adoration, satisfaction, and extolling the lord Vîçya. Vîçya, the pure, lord of purity, we praise.

4745.text: Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, has a thousand ears and ten thousand eyes, a named name, § who is worthy of honour, (and) Râma-qâçtra we praise.

4746.text: Thee, the fire, pure, lord of purity, son of Ahura-Mazda, we praise. This Barĕçma, provided with Zaŏthra and with Aiwyâonbana,* the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The Navel of the Waters we praise.

4747.text: Ushahina — from midnight till the disappearance of the stars.

4749.text: Rapithwina = from midday till the commencement of twilight.

4750.text: Uzayĕirina=from the commencement of twilight till the appearance of the stars.

4751.text: Aiwiçrûthrema=from the appearance of the stars till midnight. With each of the Gâha different Genii were associated. The time Hâvan is under the protection of Mithra, together with Çavanhi and Vîçya.

4752.text: Nairya-çaùha, the strong, highest in wisdom, worthy of honour, we praise. The souls of the departed we praise : the Fravashis of the pure. The Great God we praise, Ahura-Mazda, the Highest in parity, the Most Helpful in purity. All the words which come from Zarathustra we praise. All good work3 we praise, those done, and those which shall yet be done.— Yênhê-hâtaûm,

4753.text: Yatha ahû vairyo (2).—Offering, praise, strength, and might implore I for Mithra, who possesses wide pastures, has a thousand ears and ten thousand eyes, a named name, worthy of honour, (and) Râma-qâçtra.

4755.text: Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda. Ashem-vohû (3).—I confess (myself) a Mazdayaçnian, a disciple of Zarathustra, an adversary of the Daevas, devoted to the belief in Ahura ; to Rapith-wina, the pure, lord of purity, praise, adoration, satisfaction, and laud; to Frâdat-fshu and Zaňtuma, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc.

4756.text: To Asha-vahista and the fire (the son) of Ahura-Mazda, satisfaction, etc. As it is, etc.

4757.text: Rapithwina, the pure, lord of purity, praise we. The Gâthâ Ahunavaiti, the pure, mistress of purity, we praise. The Gâthâ Ustavaiti, the pure, mistress of purity, we praise. The Gâthâ Çpënta-mainyu, the pure, mistress of purity, we praise. The Gâthâ Vohû-Khshathra, the pure, mistress of purity, we praise. The Gâthâ Vahistôisti, the pure, mistress of purity, we praise.

4758.text: Frâdat-fshu, and Zaňtuma, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Fshusha-manthra we praise. The right-spoken speech we praise. The victorious, which destroys the Daevas, we praise. The waters and lands we praise, the trees and the heavenly Yazatas we praise, who grant blessings, the pure, the Amĕsha-çpĕntas, praise we, the pure.

4759.text: The good, strong, holy Fravashis of the pure we praise. The points of Asha-vahista‡we praise. The greatest Manthras, the greatest as to works, the greatest as to fulfilling, the greatest as to manifest works, the greatest as to the attainment of the Mazdayaçnian law, we praise.

4760.text: That assembly and meeting of the Amĕsha-çpĕntas we praise, which is prepared in the height of heaven, for the praise and adoration of Zantuma, the lord. Zantuma, the pure, lord of purity, we praise.

4761.text: Asha-vahista and the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, we praise.

4762.text: 11. Thee, the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. This Barĕçma, etc. (as in Gâh 1, 9 ff.).

4763.text: Yathâ ahû vairyo (2). Offering, praise, strength, might, implore I forAsha-vahistaand the fire (the son) of Ahura-Mazda. Ashem-vohû.—To Him belongs brightness, etc. (as in Gâh 1).

4765.text: Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda. Ashem-Tohû (3).—I confess (myself) a Mazdayaçnian, a follower of Zarathustra, an adversary of the Daevas, devoted to belief in Ahura. To Uzayêirina, the pure, lord of purity, for praise, adoration, satisfaction, and exaltation. To Fràdat-vîra, and Daqyuma, the pure, lord of purity, for praise, etc.

4766.text: Satisfaction to the great lord, the Navel of the Waters, and the water created by Mazda, etc. As it is, etc.

4768.text: Uzayêirina, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Zaöta, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Hâvanân, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Atarevakhsba, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Frâbërëta, the pure, lord of purity, praise we. Abërët, the pure, lord of purity, praise we. Acnâta, the pure, lord of purity, praise we. Raëthwiskara, the pure, lord of purity, praise we. Çraoshâvareza, the pure, lord of purity, praise we.

4769.text: ï'râdat-vîra, and Daqyuma, the pure, lord of purity, praise we. The Stars, the Moon, the Sun, the Lights, praise we. The Lights without a beginning we praise. The brightness of the precepts †we praise, which are the annihilation of the wicked man.

4770.text: The manifest acts of the pure, lords of purity, we praise. The later instruction ‡ we praise. The openly working pure, lords of purity, we praise, by day and by night, with gifts which are offered in prayer, for praise and adoration to Daqyuma the lord. Daqyuma, the pure, lord of purity, we praise.

4771.text: The great lord, possessing women, shining, the Navel of the Waters, having swift horses,* we praise. The water, created by Mazda, we praise.

4772.text: Yathâ ahû vairyo (2).—Offering, praise, strength, might, I implore for the great lord, the Navel of the Waters, the water created by Mazda. Ashem-vohû, etc. (as in Gâh 1).

4774.text: Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda. Ashem-vohû (3).—I confess (myself) a Mazdayaȱnian, a follower of Zarathustra, an adversary of the Daevas, devoted to belief in Ahura : to Aiwiçrûthrĕma Aibigaya, the pure, lord of purity, for praise, adoration, satisfaction, and laud; to Frâdat-viçparim-hujyaiti and Zarathustrŏtĕma, the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc.

4775.text: Satisfaction to the Fravashis of the pure, and to the women who have troops of men, and the yearly good dwelling ; and to the well-created strength, beautiful, to Victory and the smiting that comes from above, praise, etc. As it is, etc. (as above).

4777.text: Aiwiçrûthrëma, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Aibigaya, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Thee, the fire, the son of Ahura-Mazda, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The stone mortars, lords of purity, we praise. The iron mortars, lords of purity, we praise. This Barëçma with offering and binding, bound in holiness, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Water and trees we praise. Perfection for the souls we praise, the pure lords of purity.

4778.text: Frâdat-vîçpanm-hujyâiti, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Zarathustra, the pure, lord of purity, wc praise. The Manlhra-çpenta, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The pure Soul of the Bull, Mistress of purity, we praise. Zarathustrotëma, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Zarathustra, the pure, lord of purity, we praise.

4779.text: The pure Priests, lords of purity, we praise. The pure Warriors, lords of purity, we praise. The active pure Husbandmen, lords of purity, we praise. The pure lords of the house, lords of purity, we praise. The pure lords of the clan, lords of purity, we praise. The pure lords of the confederacy, lords of purity, we praise. The pure lords of the region, lords of purity, we praise.

4780.text: The youth who thinks good, speaks good, does good, belongs to the good law, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The youth, the speaker of prayers,* the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Him who marries amongst relations, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. Him who wanders through the region,† the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The willing worshipper, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The mistress of the house, the pure, mistress of purity, we praise.

4781.text: The pure woman we praise, who especially thinks good, speaks good, does good, lets herself be ruled well, obeys the master, the pure : Çpĕnta-ârmaiti, and what else are Thy women, 0 Ahura-Mazda. The pure man we praise, who especially thinks good, speaks and acts, who knows the faith, does not know sins, through whose deeds the worlds increase in purity, for offering and adoration to Zarathustrŏtĕma. Zarathustrŏtĕma., the pure, lord of purity, we praise.

4782.text: The good, strong, holy Fravashis of the pure, we praise. The women who have au assembly of men we praise. The yearly good dwelling we praise. Strength, the well-formed, beautiful, we praise. Victory, created by Ahura, we praise. The smiting that comes from above we praise.

4784.text: Yathâ ahû vairyo (2). Offering, praise, strength, might, implore I for the Fravashis of the pure, for the women who have troops of men, for the yearly good dwelling, for strength, the well-formed, beautiful, for the victory which comes from Ahura, for the smiting which comes from above.

4786.text: Satisfaction to Ahura-Mazda. Ashem-vohû (3). I confess (myself) a Mazdayaçnian, a follower of Zarathustra, an adversary of the Daevas, devoted to belief in Ahura : To Ushahina, the pure, lord of purity, for praise, etc., to Berejya, and Nmânya the pure, lord of purity, praise, etc.

4787.text: Satisfaction to Çraŏsha , the holy, sublime, victorious, who advances the world, and to Rashnu, the most upright, and Arstat, who furthers the world, increases the world, praise, etc. As it is, etc.

4788.text: Ushahina, the pure, lord of purity, we praise. The fair morning-dawn we praise. The dawn we praise, the "brilliant, with brilliant horses, which thinks of men, which thinks of heroes, which is provided with brightness, with dwellings. The dawn we praise, the rejoicing, provided with swift steeds, which floats over the earth, consisting of seven Keshvars. That dawn we praise. Ahura-Mazda, the pure, Lord of purity, we praise. Vohû-mano we praise. Asha-vahista we praise. Khshathra-vairya we praise. Çpĕnta-ârmaiti we praise.

4789.text: Berejya, the pure, lord of purity, we praise, out of longing for the blessing of purity, from longing for the good Mazda-yaçnian law, for praise and adoration to the lord Nmânya. Nmânya, the pure, lord of purity, we praise.

4790.text: Oraŏsha, the holy, beautiful, victorious, advancing the world, pure, lord of purity, wo praise. Rashnu, the most upright, we praise. Arstât, who advances the world, who increases the world, we praise.

4792.text: Yathâ ahû vairyo (2). Offering, praise, strength, might, implore I for Çraŏsha , the holy, sublime, victorious, who advances the world, and Rashnu the most upright, and Arstât who advances the world, increases the world. Ashem-vohû, etc,

4793.text: Zarathustra asked Ahura-Mazda: Ahura-Mazda! Heavenly, Holy, Creator of the corporeal world, Pure One !

4794.text: What is the mightiest of the Marithra Çpĕn ta, what the most victorious, what the most majestic, what that which most brings fulfilment to prayers, what the most victoriously smiting, what the most healing, what most torments the tormentings of the Daevas and (evil) men, what is of the whole corporeal world the most helpful to me, what is that of the whole corporeal world which most purifies the inward parts ?

4795.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda : [As to] Our Names, the Amĕsha-çpĕntas, 0 holy Zarathustra, that is the mightiest of the Manthra-çpĕnta, that the most victorious, that the mo3t majestic, that that which most brings fulfilment to prayers, that the most victoriously smiting, that the most healing, that inflicts most torments on the Daevas and (wicked) men, that is of the whole corporeal world the most helpful from me, that it is of the whole corporeal world which most purifies the inward parts.

4796.text: Then spake Zarathustra ; Tell me then the Name, 0 pure Ahura-Mazda, which is Thy greatest, best, and fairest, which is most efficacious for prayers, the most victoriously smiting and the most healing, which most torments the torments of the Daevas and the (wicked) men.

4797.text: That I also may torment all Daevas and (wicked) men, that I may torment all sorcerers and Pairikas, that no one may torment me, neither Daeva, nor man, nor sorcerer, nor Pairika.

4798.text: Then answered Ahura-Mazda ; My Name is : The to be questioned, 0 pure Zarathustra ; the second : the Gatherer;* the third: the Spreader abroad ; the fourth: Best Purity ; the fifth : All good thing" created by Mazda which have a pure origin ; the sixth: I am the Understanding; the seventh: I am Endowed with understanding ; the eighth : I am "Wisdom ; the ninth : I am Endowed with Wisdom; the tenth: I am the Increaser; the eleventh : I am Endowed with Increase ; the twelfth : the Lord; the thirteenth: the Most Profitable; the fourteenth: He who is without harm ; the fifteenth : the Steadfast ; the sixteenth : the Reckoner of service † the seventeenth: the All-observing ; the eighteenth : the Healing ; the nineteenth : that I am the Creator ; the twentieth : that 1 bear the Name Mazda.

4799.text: Praise me, Zarathustra, day and night with gifts which are brought hither midst prayers.

4800.text: I will come to thee for protection and joy, I who am Ahura-Mazda ; there shall come to thee for protection and joy : the good Çraŏsha , the holy : there shall come to thee for protection and joy: Water, trees, and the Fravashis of the pure.

4801.text: If thou wishest, 0 Zarathustra, thou mayest torment these torments of the Daevas and men, of the sorcerers and Pairikas, of the Çâthras, Kavis and Karapanas ;‡

4802.text: Of the destructive two-legged, of the two-legged Ashĕm- aŏgas.§

4803.text: The wolf with four feet, the hosts consisting of many foes, with many banners, with high banners, with uplifted banners, carrying a wounded banner.*

4804.text: These Names preserve, (and) utter them day and night.

4805.text: I am the Protector, I am the Creator, I am the Nourisher, I am the Knowing, J am the Holiest Heavenly One.

4806.text: My name is : The Healing ; my name is : The Most Healing ; my name is : The Priest ; my name is : The Most Priestly ; my name is: God(Ahura); my name is: Great Wise One (Mazda);

4807.text: My name is : The Pure ; my name is : The Purest; I am called, The Majestic ; I am called The Most Majestic ;

4808.text: I am called, The Much-seeing ; I am called, The Most Much-seeing;† 1 am called, The Far-seeing; I am called, The Most Far-seeing ;

4809.text: I am called, The Watcher; I am called, The Desirer;‡ I am called, The Creator; I am called, The Protector; I am called, The Nourisher; I am called, The Knower; I am called, The Most Knowing;

4810.text: I am called, The Augmenter; I am called, Possessing increasing Manthras ; § I am called, The Ruler at Will ; I am called, The Most Ruling at Will ;

4811.text: I am called, The Ruling with Name; || I am called, The Most Ruling with Name ; I am called, The Not to be Deceived ; I am called, The Undeceived ;

4812.text: I am called, The Protecting ; I am called, The Tormentor of Torment; I am called, The Smiting here; I am called, The All-smiting ; I am called, The All-creating ;

4813.text: I am called,The All-Majestic; I am called, Endued with much Majesty ; I am called, The Very Majestic ; I am called, Endued with Very Great Majesty ; I am called, The Effecting-profit ; I am called, The Working-gain ; I am called, The Profitable ;

4814.text: I am called, The Strong; I am called, The Most Profitable; I am called, The Pure; I am called, The Great;

4815.text: I am called, The Kingly ; I am called, The Most Kingly ; I am called, The Well-wise ; I am called, The Well-wisest ; I am called, The Far-seeing.**

4816.text: These my names—he who in the corporeal world, 0 holy Zarathustra, maintains and speaks these my names :

4817.text: By day and night, standing or sitting, sitting or standing, girt with the Aiwyâonhana,* or drawing off the Aiwyâorihana,

4818.text: Going forwards out of the house, going forwards out of the confederacy, going forwards out of the region, coming into a region, †

4819.text: Such a man the points of the Drukhs-souled, proceeding from Aêshma, will not injure in that day or that night, not the slings, not the arrows, not knives, not clubs, the missiles will not penetrate, (and) he be injured.

4820.text: And on account of accepting (it) the same take upon themselves with names to be a support and wall against the invisible Drukhs, the Varenian, wicked.

4821.text: Against the striving to hurt, greedy of revenge, all slaying, wholly evil Anra-mainyus.

4822.text: Like as a thousand men can control one single man.—

4823.text: Who is the victoriously smiting? etc. (Yaçna xliii. 16).

4824.text: Praise to the kingly majesty, praise to Airyana-vaêja, praise to the profit created by Ahura-Mazda, praise to the water Dâitya, praise to the water Ardvî-çûra the pure, praise to the whole world of purity.

4825.text: Yathâ ahû vairyo (10). Ashem-vohû. (10). The Ahuna-vairya praise we. Asha-vahista, the fairest Amĕsha-çpënta, praise we. Strength, might, power, victoriousness, and strength, praise we. Ahura-Mazda, the Shining, Majestic, praise we.

4826.text: Protect the kinsmen evermore, 0 Zarathustra, from the hostile evil-minded.‡

4827.text: Do not abandon the friend to the stroke, not to the enduring of evil, not to the touching of harm.

4828.text: Do not wish a gift for the man who, instead of the greatest offering, offers us the least ; of that which is to be offered, complete praise for us, the Amĕsha-cpĕlntas. §

4829.text: Here is Vohû-mano, my creature, O Zarathustra ; Asha-vahista, my creature,O Zarathustra; Khshathra-vairya, my creature, 0 Zarathustra ; Çpënta-ârmaiti, my creature, 0 Zarathustra; here are Haurvat and Ameretat, my creatures, O Zarathustra, which are a reward for the pure who attain to incorporeality. ||

4830.text: Know also how it (is), 0 pure Zarathustra: through My wisdom, through which was the beginning of the world, so also its end shall be.

4831.text: A thousand remedies, ten thousand remedies (3). Come to my help, 0 Mazda.—To strength, the well-created, beautiful, and the victory created by Mazda, and the smiting which comes from above, and Çpĕnta-ârmaiti.

4832.text: 0 Çpĕnta-ârmaiti ! smite their torments, surround their understanding, bind their hands, summer and winter smite, restrain the hinderers.

4833.text: When, 0 Mazda, will the pure smite the wicked, when the pure the Drukhs, when the pure the evil ?

4834.text: The understanding of Ahura-Mazda we praise, to lay hold of the Mańthra-cpĕnta. The understanding of Ahnra-Mazda wo praise, to maintain the Mańthra-çpĕnta in remembrance. The tongue of Ahura-Mazda we praise, to be able to utter the Mańthra-çpĕnta. This mountain praise we, Ushi-darĕna, bestowing understanding, day and night, with gifts brought amidst prayers.

4835.text: Then spake Zarathustra : I come to yon, the eyes of Çpĕnta-ârmaiti, who annihilate what is desert in the earth, to hunt the wicked.

4836.text: The Fravashi of that pure man I praise, who bears the name of Açmô-qanvâo.* More than the other pure will I hereafter praise as a Believer, Gaŏkĕrĕna, the strong, created by Mazda, Gaokĕrĕna, the strong, created by Mazda, we praise. The understanding of Ahura-Mazda we praise, to inculcate in the Mańthra-çpĕnta. The understanding of Ahura-Mazda we praise, to maintain the Mańthra-çpĕnta. The tongue of Ahura-Mazda we praise, to be able to utter the Mańthra-çpĕnta The mountain Ushi-darĕna, which bestows understanding, we praise by day and night, with gifts brought amidst prayers.

4837.text: To* Ahura-Mazda, the Shining, Majestic, to the Amĕsha-çpĕntas, to Vohu-manô, to the peace which smites victoriously, which is placed over other creatures, to the heavenly understanding created by Ahura-Mazda, to the understanding heard with the ears, created by Mazda :

4838.text: To Asha-vahista, the fairest, to Airyama-ishya.f the strong, created by Mazda, to Çaŏka the good, gifted with far-seeing eyes, created by Mazda, pare, to Khshathra-vairya, the metal, to charity which feeds the beggars :

4839.text: To the good Çpĕnta-ârmaiti, to skilfulness, the good, gifted with far-seeing eyes, created by Mazda, pure, to Haurvât the lord, to the yearly good dwelling, to the years, the lords of purity, to Ameretât, the lord, to fullness which concerns the cattle, to the corn which belongs to horses, to Gaŏkĕrĕna, the strong, created by Mazda :
